7:00.race_name: Free Bets With BetUK Bet Club Handicap

runners.name: Arnhem
runners.comment: Useful in Ireland but with modest strike-rate; this 9yo may be best watched on yard debut
runners.spotlight: Plenty of useful form in Ireland but with a modest strike-rate and no win since August 2023; below par in November when last seen; this 9yo may be best watched on his stable debut.

runners.name: Secret Guest
runners.comment: C&D winner who went close over C&D in December; in the mix if at the top of his game
runners.spotlight: Merely sixth over C&D in January when last seen but went close over C&D two starts ago and he scored over C&D last February; in the mix if at the top of his game back from a 99-day break.

runners.name: Gressington
runners.comment: 6f win at Redcar last September; not ruled out now back down in trip on reappearance
runners.spotlight: Tapeta winner who scored in first-time blinkers (retained since) at Redcar (6f, turf) last September; faded into fifth at Southwell (7f, AW) the following month and he's not ruled out now back down to 6f on reappearance.

quotes.race: At The Races App Form Study Restricted Novice Stakes (No More Than 3 Runs) (Bands B-D) (GBB)(Div II)
quotes.quote: Gressington was green in the preliminaries and he will improve a bundle. It was a nice debut he can improve from and I feel there were some smart types in the race, so hopefully the form has a bit of substance to it - Ed Bethell, trainer.

runners.name: Solar Aclaim
runners.comment: Unproven on AW but ended last season in good form on turf; makes reappearance
runners.spotlight: Well beaten on Polytrack last June on sole AW start but ended last season in good heart on turf on his favoured testing ground, and he can be thereabouts if transferring that form to Tapeta on his reappearance.

runners.name: Grant Wood

prev_owners.owner: Samuel M Mencoff & Anthony Paul Smurfit

runners.comment: Four wins last year (including C&D) and reappeared with good second at Wolverhampton
runners.spotlight: Four wins last year (including C&D) and reappeared with good second at Wolverhampton (6f, AW) last month; every chance he'll be in the shake-up.

quotes.race: William Hill Silver Trophy Handicap
quotes.quote: I'm chuffed for Grant Wood, this horse has been so good all year. He keeps doing personal bests and he did win well. He deserves to win a decent prize. He ran a great race at Haydock and things didn't drop right. He's kept getting better and better as the season's gone on - Paul Midgley, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: Graham Lee galloped him one day last April on his way to Beverley and all he did was talk about this horse. But he never showed it on the track last year and was one of ours who wasn't quite right. So we chucked him out into the field and when he came back in he was the horse he was last April. He's been great. He won two on the bounce on the all-weather and then nothing really dropped right for him. The worst thing for him was winning over 7f at Southwell because it made us go back to running him over that trip and he's just an out-and-out 6f horse now. When we brought him back to 6f at Haydock last time the race set up beautifully for him and he won. He was drawn next to the best horse who went forward - there were a lot of non-runners because of the ground - and all he had to do was follow the leader, although he won well to be fair. I was probably more surprised at how well he handled a faster surface. He'll probably go back to Haydock in a couple of weeks' time. 28-06-24

runners.name: Tough Enough
runners.comment: Three-time winner; on a reduced mark but a return to form is needed
runners.spotlight: Won three times for James Tate (including on Tapeta) and is below last winning mark, but he was soundly beaten on his sole run last year and it was the same story on last month's stable debut; others have less to prove.

stable_tour.quote: This colt came to us from the Dubai breeze-ups and has done nothing wrong. He ran three times last year, improving with each one and ending in a win at Wolverhampton. We found out that he doesn't like it too soft after getting bogged down in the mud at Nottingham. But his win on the all-weather did him good mentally, while physically he has really filled out. He'll continue to progress over 6f or 7f. 19-04-23

runners.name: William Dewhirst

prev_owners.owner: D Widdup, K Nicol, C Cleevely & R Tocher

runners.comment: Has won six times here since November, five over 7f but one over C&D; could be thereabouts
runners.spotlight: Has won six times here since November, five over 7f but one over C&D; close second of four over C&D four weeks ago; could be thereabouts.

quotes.race: Weekly £5 Free Bet With BetUK Handicap
quotes.quote: William Dewhirst did well in November and December as well. There's a race here for him in mid-February, a 0-85 that he should get into, but obviously as he creeps up the handicap, we'll have to start boxing clever with how we place him to maximise points -  Ben Haslam, trainer.

quotes.race: Boost Your Acca At BetMGM Handicap
quotes.quote: William Dewhurst saw a bit too much daylight last time and is quite enthusiastic but today I've managed to get in that box seat and get plenty of cover. I was just saying to Ben [Haslam, trainer] he's really grown in the last three months and he's filled out into a big, fine horse with not many miles on the clock and he loves this place - Paul Mulrennan, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Monks Dream
runners.comment: Three wins from six course visits; on a career-high mark but still a key player
runners.spotlight: Runner-up twice in a row here (6f/5f) before going one better over 5f here four weeks ago; now on a career-high mark but this lightly raced 4yo's course form-figures read 117221 and he's a key player once more.

quotes.race: £30 In Free Bets With BetUK Handicap
quotes.quote: They weren't the tactics we really wanted to employ but Monks Dream did the same thing the last day, he just rushed the gates before they opened. In a race like that over five furlongs when you miss the beat you're going to be held up. The way the race worked out, perhaps if he was handy he might not have finished as well as he did. Now let's see if he can transfer that form to grass - Sean Kirrane, jockey, speaking on Sky Sports Racing.

stable_tour.quote: He won't run early as he's been very backward. It was the same last year, but he progressed well when he came out and is a tough horse. He's one for six-furlong races in mid-season. 23-04-24

runners.name: Flying Fletcher
runners.comment: Two-time C&D winner; close third here on two of his last three starts; each-way claims
runners.spotlight: Two-time C&D winner, the latest in November; in and out since but he's been a close third to William Dewhirst here on two of his last three starts (6f/7f) and holds each-way claims.

runners.name: Ormolulu
runners.comment: Prolific on Southwell Tapeta this winter but failed to shine over this C&D in February
runners.spotlight: Three 6f wins on the Southwell Tapeta this winter; has run well in defeat there the last twice but she failed to shine over this C&D in February on her sole previous visit to Newcastle, so has something to prove today.

runners.name: The Turpinator

prev_owners.owner: Ursa Major Racing Ltd And G Tuer
Bighouse Synd , J Rosier & C Rosier

runners.comment: Course winner who scored on turf last June, but below best on last two runs in September
runners.spotlight: Course winner who is just 1lb higher than when winning at Pontefract (6f) last June; however, this 8yo wasn't at his best on his final two runs last September and needs to get back on track on today's reappearance.

stable_tour.quote: He won twice for us last season, at Thirsk and Newcastle. He's a solid handicapper who runs in all the big seven-furlong races in the north. He hasn't run since February but has a target at York on Friday in an apprentice handicap. 14-06-24

runners.name: Jenever
runners.comment: Has plenty of good course form and he reappears with his trainer among the winners
runners.spotlight: Has plenty of good 5f course form and went close here in November when last seen; good fourth in Ayr Silver Cup over 6f in September; reappears with trainer among the winners (including with one who lacked a recent run) and he could have a part to play.

runners.name: Jungle Land
runners.breeder: G H S Bloodstock & J C Bloodstock
runners.comment: Lightly raced 4yo who has been better than ever this spring & can be bang there once more
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced 4yo who reappeared with a career-best performance to win at Wolverhampton (6f, Tapeta) last month, and he bumped into a progressive winner when second there (6f) nine days ago under a penalty; able to run off 1lb lower than last time and can be bang there once more.

stable_tour.quote: He ran well at Wolverhampton and was just unlucky to bump into one. He could be out again this week, and he might also go to Lingfield on April 18 for a £65,000 handicap. He's a fun handicapper for the summer. 07-04-25

runners.name: Lethal Nymph

prev_owners.owner: Exors Of The Late Trevor Fox

runners.comment: Without a win since 2022 but on a dangerous mark judged on the pick of last season's form
runners.spotlight: Without a win since 2022 and last year's best efforts came over 5f; however, he's dropped to a dangerous mark judged on the pick of last season's form (including here) and he could improve for last month's reappearance sixth at Wolverhampton; not ruled out.

stable_tour.quote: He's done really well over the winter and wants quicker ground rather than slower. We'll look at a summer campaign over six furlongs. Ascot suits him really well and hopefully he could be one for the Wokingham. 02-05-23

We've put a bit more speed into him. He didn't do anything wrong at Thirsk the other day when he was second and he probably bumped into a well-handicapped one of Jim Goldie's. He's come out of the race really well. There's a good prize in him and the plan is to go for the Rockingham at the Curragh on Sunday. I imagine the Curragh will suit him as it's a stiff 5f with plenty of speed on from start to finish. He's uncomplicated to ride. 28-06-24

6:00.race_name: BetMGM: It's Showtime Restricted Novice Stakes (For horses In Bands C And D) (GBB Race)

runners.name: One More Bottle
runners.comment: Well beaten in both bumpers and same story here on his two Flat starts (1m/7f)
runners.spotlight: Well beaten in both bumpers and same story when triple-figure odds here on his two Flat starts (1m/7f).

runners.name: Sogannie
runners.comment: Half-sister to four winners who is open to improvement on second start; not ruled out e-w
runners.spotlight: 25-1 when soundly beaten third of five on debut over C&D three weeks ago; however, that gives her something to build on and she's a half-sister to four winners; not ruled out each-way.

stable_tour.quote: She's an unraced half-sister to Bobby Joe Leg and we call her Annie - for obvious reasons. She's got a good attitude but I'm still finding out about her and will know more on Thursday when she makes her debut in a Newcastle novice. 09-04-25

runners.name: Double Parked
runners.breeder: Al Shira'Aa Farms S A R L
runners.comment: Kept on for close third over 6f here on reappearance and firmly in calculations
runners.spotlight: Improved upon last September's first two runs (6f, turf) when keeping on for close third over 6f here on last month's reappearance; firmly in calculations after that promising effort.

runners.name: Georgecandoit
runners.comment: Disappointing on final run last season but consistent previously and he's respected
runners.spotlight: Made it 0-6 when disappointing in Pontefract nursery (6f, soft) on final run last year but consistent previously over 5f/6f, and there can be optimism this longer trip will suit; respected on his seasonal/AW debut.

runners.name: Hurricane Bea
runners.comment: Well beaten on both starts (C&D latest) and dramatic improvement is required
runners.spotlight: Down the field at 40-1 on sole 2yo run and well beaten at 200-1 over this C&D 12 days ago; dramatic improvement is required.

stable_tour.quote: We got him at the breeze-up sales. He's had only one run, at Redcar, where he missed the break slightly and just needed a bit further. That was over 6f but he's in the 7f Convivial Maiden at York on Friday. 22-08-24

runners.name: Shamador
runners.owner: Hambleton Racing Ltd Xxxi And Partner
runners.comment: Returns from a break having been gelded; major player if recapturing his C&D debut promise
runners.spotlight: Runner-up on debut over C&D last September; two lesser runs followed but he returns from a break having been gelded and he's a major player for his good Lambourn trainer if recapturing his initial promise.

runners.name: Bin Ajwad
runners.comment: Half-brother to two classy winners; makes debut with yard in good form; watch the betting
runners.spotlight: 8,000euros yearling, 5,000euros 2yo breeze-ups; 11th foal; Magna Grecia half-brother to winners Amona (German Group-placed 1m2f) and Coral Beach (6f/7f 2yo including Group 3); makes debut with Newmarket stable among the winners and well worth a second look if attracting market support.

runners.name: Four Fifty
runners.comment: Half brother to two winners but this newcomer might be one for further down the line
runners.spotlight: Third foal; Ulysses half-brother to winners Night Arc (1m/1m2f; RPR 82) and Kouthni Maak (Saudi Arabia 1m2f); dam 7f winner (100); this newcomer might be one for further down the line, over a bit further.

runners.name: Aoifes Thunder
runners.comment: 50-1 and well beaten on sole run but this well-bred filly could take sizeable step forward
runners.spotlight: 50-1 when soundly beaten at Wolverhampton (7f, Tapeta) in December, when racing wide and green; needs to be an entirely different proposition today but there's potential in her pedigree and her stable is in fine form; no surprise if she takes a sizeable step forward.

runners.name: Carida
runners.comment: Encouraging fifth on recent debut and she's an interesting contender on this second start
runners.spotlight: 66-1 and wore a hood (retained) for last month's debut at Wolverhampton (7f, Tapeta), but she made encouraging late headway in the straight until being denied a clear run, finishing fifth; interesting contender on second run.

runners.name: City Of Strangers
runners.comment: Displayed some ability last September; new trip but others have more substance to claims
runners.spotlight: Displayed some ability last September on both runs for Craig Lidster (5f, AW/good); pedigree hints this trip may be a better fit but others have more substance to their claims; yard debut (still in same ownership).

runners.name: Princess Pw
runners.owner: Miss P Wothersoon, Michael Watt, B Crew

prev_owners.owner: Miss P Wotherspoon & Michael H Watt

runners.comment: Didn't see out 1m1f on handicap debut; might not be far away now back down in trip
runners.spotlight: Promising in defeat in November-January on her first four starts (7f-8.6f, including on Tapeta) and she didn't see out 1m1f at Musselburgh eight days ago on handicap debut; might not be far away now back down in trip in first-time blinkers.

runners.name: Storm Kitty
runners.comment: No threat here last month on first two starts; transformation needed now in cheekpieces
runners.spotlight: Well-backed 10-1 shot on last month's debut over C&D but was soundly beaten, and was tailed off over 1m2f here subsequently; transformation needed in first-time cheekpieces.

5:00.race_name: £30 In Free Bets With BetUK Handicap (GBBPlus Race)

runners.name: King Chaos
runners.comment: Won Southwell novice in December and he could have potential off his opening mark
runners.spotlight: Third on first three starts (including over C&D) before winning Southwell novice (1m3f, AW) in December last time; has a useful pedigree and this lightly raced 4yo could have potential off his opening mark.

runners.name: Cadarn
runners.comment: Can play a leading role on handicap debut if tapping into promise of first two Flat runs
runners.spotlight: Runner-up over C&D and at Wolverhampton (1m4f, AW) last autumn on first two Flat starts; below par over C&D in December when last seen but can play a leading role on handicap debut if tapping back into previous promise.

stable_tour.quote: I've yet to run him on turf, but his work has been pretty good this spring and I hope he's now matured and we'll see the best of him. His form slightly dipped on his last start and I hope we can get him in the winner's circle before long. 07-04-25

runners.name: Creatif
runners.comment: Promise in France; tailed off on yard debut but gelding/wind ops since; retains potential
runners.spotlight: Well-bred 4yo who showed considerable promise in France last year on first two starts and was sold for 140,000euros last July; tailed off on British debut at Ripon in September but returns having had gelding and wind operations; retains potential for good yard; market strength could prove significant.

runners.name: Cougar

prev_owners.owner: M Tabor & D Smith & Mrs J Magnier & Westerberg

runners.comment: Well beaten over hurdles early this year and same story over C&D on recent stable debut
runners.spotlight: Useful on the Flat and over hurdles in 2022; however, he struggled on two hurdle starts earlier this year and was well beaten back on the Flat over C&D on stable debut three weeks ago; lots to prove.

quotes.race: Value Cabs 3-Y-O Hurdle
quotes.quote: I thought Cougar was very keen which wouldn't be like him. He jumped great and it's great to have a horse like him in the yard. He doesn't mind these  conditions and it is great that he won, I'm delighted to have him. Mark said he jumped well and he is improving all the time. He is a horse to look forward to - Paudie Roche, trainer

quotes.race: gowranpark.ie 3-Y-O Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Cougar is an exciting horse to get. When he got going Mark said he really got the hang of it. It was a lovely introduction - Padraig Roche, trainer.

runners.name: Sea Legend
runners.comment: A return to form is needed but he's back from a break with his new yard in excellent form
runners.spotlight: Well beaten over hurdles and on the Flat here on his final two outings for Donald McCain; however, he returns from a two-month break with his new trainer in excellent form, and he's 2lb lower than when winning over C&D last May; goes without headgear; not written off.

quotes.race: Download The Raceday Ready App Handicap (Div I)
quotes.quote: We got Sea Legend but he had a problem in behind so he had to have a long time off. We gelded him and the last month he's gone nicely. He enjoyed that trip, he's got a big, long stride and I'm really pleased with that on his first run back. It was a relief to go to the races and run so well. I think he'll be suited by a mile and a half and we'll look at all the options in those nice handicaps. That was his first run for a year, so we wanted to get it out the way before making plans - James Fanshawe, trainer.

runners.name: Ninth Life
runners.comment: Absent since win at Southwell last March but returns with yard in fine form
runners.spotlight: Made it 2-5 for this yard when winning at Southwell (1m3f, Tapeta) last March; absent since but returns with yard in fine form; possible player.

runners.name: Molinari
runners.owner: Mr & Mrs G F Hall Racing

prev_owners.owner: Exors Of The Late Mrs Kathleen Hall

runners.comment: Won here on final two runs last year; might need this comeback with entitled to respect
runners.spotlight: Won here last autumn on his last two outings (C&D on second occasion); this 8yo has improved for his reappearance run in each of the last two seasons but is entitled to respect given his liking for this track.

runners.name: Cusack
runners.comment: His recent course wins have been over 7f but he's versatile trip-wise; contender
runners.spotlight: Won here on March 22 when dropped back to 7f and he followed up over the same trip 12 days ago, for course win number nine; up in grade and back up in distance today, but he's versatile trip-wise and this in-form course specialist could have another major say.

8:00.race_name: Win £1M With BetMGM's Golden Goals Handicap (Div I)

runners.name: Thats My Boy Luke
runners.comment: Went close over C&D last month; down the field at Southwell since but not written off
runners.spotlight: Close third in first-time cheekpieces (retained since) over C&D last month; failed to back that up at Southwell (1m, AW) a fortnight ago and he's now 0-10, but he's not written off.

runners.name: Cuban Fiesta
runners.comment: 0-11 but good second over C&D on last month's stable/seasonal debut
runners.spotlight: Winless after 11 starts and the first-time visor he wore on last month's stable and seasonal debut over C&D is now left off, but he was a good second that day and will hold strong claims if repeating the form.

runners.name: Rooska
runners.comment: 0-11 but close second over 7f here recently and can be bang there if seeing out 1m
runners.spotlight: 0-11 and has something to prove at this trip, but he was a close second of six over 7f here 16 days ago and can be bang there if seeing out 1m.

stable_tour.quote: He only made his racecourse debut in May when third over 5f. His work has always been decent and I thought stepping him up to 6f next time out at Redcar would see him win. But, despite running a smashing race, he had to take second behind Happier. He ran back over the same course and distance last time when he was third but came back rather sore, hence he hasn't run in more than two months. He's sound again now and an opening mark of 67 looks attractive to me. I'm not sure whether he'll go for another maiden or straight to a handicap. He's a fine, big gelding with lots of potential. 30-08-23

runners.name: Jumeira Vision
runners.owner: Ursa Major Racing Ltd And Partner
runners.comment: Well beaten at Wolverhampton latest but won there two starts ago; chance if on a going day
runners.spotlight: Inconsistent and well beaten at Wolverhampton in January on latest start; however, he won there (9.4f, Tapeta) two starts ago and posted a hat-trick last summer; a contender if he's on a going day.

quotes.race: Visit racingtv.com Handicap
quotes.quote: Sam James gave Jumeira Vision him a wonderful ride, he was very tough but Sam did think he had a bit left in the tank at the finish. It was a bit of a shock when Jumeira Vision won last time, although Katie has always said he works well at home. It's more that the conditions haven't been right until now - Craig Talbot, owners' spokesperson.

quotes.race: Woodsmith Construction Straight Mile 'Confined' Handicap (No Win In 2024) (Straight Mile Qualifier)
quotes.quote: I didn't really go into it with any plan. Katie said Jumeira Vision had been working well at home but wasn't showing it on the track, so ride him as I found him. I put my hands on his neck and it worked out! Sometimes we make too much [of the rail bias], but I do think it's an advantage getting on to those tyre tracks. You're still not going to win if you don't have the horse, however, and he travelled well to get there in the first place - Sam James, rider, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.name: Odd Socks Havana
runners.comment: Five-time course winner who went close over C&D three starts ago; could be involved
runners.spotlight: Five-time course winner (latest last April) who went close over C&D last month; fair efforts when sixth over C&D the last twice, most recently on stable debut, and there's every chance he'll be involved.

runners.name: Impeach

prev_owners.owner: The Attwater Partnership And J Daniels

runners.comment: Continues to edge down the weights but he's without a win since November 2023
runners.spotlight: Continues to edge down the weights and he's run the odd fair race this year, but he's without a win since November 2023 and it's hard to be confident regarding his claims.

runners.name: Going Underground
runners.owner: H S Hutchinson And W Glass
runners.comment: Modest strike-rate but has won over C&D and Billy Loughnane is booked for reappearance
runners.spotlight: Inconsistent and has a modest strike-rate but won over C&D in 2022 and at Ayr last June; good second at Ripon last August when last seen and Billy Loughnane is booked for his reappearance; capable if fully tuned up.

runners.name: Pop Favorite

prev_owners.owner: J Thomas, B Thomas, S Wright&j Sweeney

runners.comment: His last six wins have come here and he was a respectable fourth at Southwell last time
runners.spotlight: Beaten on his last 14 starts going back to last October but his last six wins have come over C&D and he twice went close over C&D earlier this year; respectable fourth at Southwell last time; one to consider back here.

runners.name: Yaahobby

prev_owners.owner: M Styler, K Chambers & A Brittain

runners.comment: Two-time 7f course winner but recent form has been mixed and he's unproven at 1m
runners.spotlight: Two-time 7f course winner who went close in 7f classified here in January but his subsequent form has been mixed and he's unproven at 1m.

6:30.race_name: Boost Your Acca At BetMGM Maiden Fillies' Stakes (GBB Race)

runners.name: Bun Bang Fai
runners.comment: 65,000gns yearling by Pinatubo; yard had 3yo maiden runner short-headed at 11-8 on Monday
runners.spotlight: 65,000gns yearling by Pinatubo; fourth foal; closely related to 1m AW winner Unassuming (RPR 85), half-sister to useful 2m hurdle winner Bacchanalian; dam 1m AW winner (73), sister to French 1m winner Black Fever, out of half-sister to Irish Oaks winner Moonstone; needs a market check on debut, with the yard having had a 3yo maiden runner short-headed at 11-8 on Monday.

runners.name: Camzara
runners.owner: G C Myddelton & V E C Taylor
runners.comment: About 7l fifth of 11 when 50-1 in C&D maiden last October; worth a peek in the market
runners.spotlight: 77,000euros yearling by Camelot; likely to come into her own later and over further, having been beaten about 7l in fifth of 11 when 50-1 in C&D maiden last October; worth a peek in the market, though.

runners.name: Jowddah
runners.comment: 2yo 2nds on turf at Newmarket, Salisbury and Yarmouth (1m; made most); the clear form pick
runners.spotlight: Useful pedigree; her seconds on turf at Newmarket (7f), Salisbury (7f) and Yarmouth (1m; made most) last August-October make her the clear pick on form.

runners.name: Naallat
runners.comment: Frankel half-sister to winners Kaasirr (7f/1m; RPR 80) and Tarraff (1m4f; 80); dam useful
runners.spotlight: Fourth foal; Frankel half-sister to winners Kaasirr (7f/1m; RPR 80) and Tarraff (1m4f; 80); dam 6f-1m winner (including 2yo/Listed; 103), half-sister to useful 6f-1m winner Yattwee, out of 5f 2yo Group 3 winner; same owner as Jowddah; on her debut, the market moves should be revealing.

runners.name: Noche Clasica
runners.comment: 100,000gns yearling by Night Of Thunder; late foal and makes debut but for powerful yard
runners.spotlight: 100,000gns yearling by Night Of Thunder; third foal; half-sister to winners No Retreat (UAE 7f; RPR 99) and Esquiline (Listed-placed 1m4f; 94); dam 7.3f-1m4f winner (including 2yo/Listed; 103), sister to Group 2 winners Manuela De Vega (1m4f) and Hero Look (Italian 7.5f 2yo); late foal and makes debut but for powerful yard and she needs a close look.

runners.name: Princess Amber
runners.comment: 22-1, always midfield when showing modest form in novice at Southwell (7f, AW) in February
runners.spotlight: 47,000euros yearling by Lope De Vega; 22-1, always midfield when showing modest form in novice at Southwell (7f, AW) in February.

runners.name: Star Cast
runners.comment: Last go for Sir Mark Prescott when front-running 3rd at Yarmouth (1m, soft); 17,000gns buy
runners.spotlight: Improved through her three starts last August/October for Sir Mark Prescott, front-running third of eight in novice at Yarmouth (1m, soft) on final outing; needs better on this first run since sold for 17,000gns in October.

runners.name: Word Of Mouth
runners.comment: Not the form pick, but capable of better after she met trouble in running at Southwell
runners.spotlight: Wootton Bassett filly and dam won at up to 1m6f; going down by just over 2l in fifth of eight for novice at Southwell (1m, Tapeta; 16-1) three weeks ago was much better than her sole 2yo start, and she met trouble in running trying to come from the rear; not the form pick but capable of better.

5:30.race_name: Best Odds Guaranteed At BetMGM Handicap

runners.name: Bellator Bullet
runners.breeder: M S And C S Griffiths
runners.comment: Hasn't kicked on from promising debut but he could improve for his recent reappearance
runners.spotlight: Well beaten on his four starts since runner-up on debut at Redcar (7f) last July; however, he could improve for his recent reappearance and he's the only one other than Bruce Banner who has shown any worthwhile form.

runners.name: Bruce Banner
runners.comment: In good form at Kempton and has been found a very weak race for his stable debut
runners.spotlight: Won when upped markedly in trip at Kempton (1m4f, Polytrack) in January on final run for Gary Brown, and good third for Ollie Sangster there (1m4f) next time; changed hands for 15,500gns last month and has been found a very weak race for his debut for Rebecca Menzies; leading claims.

runners.name: U S Grant
runners.comment: Has shown very little but by Camelot and could improve for the step up in trip
runners.spotlight: Has shown very little across his five starts (7f/1m); has plenty to prove but he's attracted market support in both handicaps and he's by Camelot, so could improve for the step up in trip; not written off in weak race.

runners.name: Max The Tiger
runners.comment: Failed to beat a rival across his four 2yo starts but the step up in trip could help
runners.spotlight: Well beaten on all four 2yo starts and failed to beat a rival; however, he's from a staying family and should be suited by the step up in trip on reappearance; might not be a forlorn hope; monitor the betting.

runners.name: Bow Street
runners.comment: Won over C&D last November and kept on for fair fourth over 5f at Lingfield recently
runners.spotlight: Mixed form last season but he won off this mark over C&D in November and kept on for a fair fourth at Lingfield (5f, AW) a fortnight ago; could have a big say now back up in trip.

runners.name: Francis Drake
runners.comment: Headed in final stride over 7f on recent handicap debut; sprinting is well worth a go
runners.spotlight: Improved upon his first three runs (all 1m, AW) when going very close on recent handicap debut at Lingfield (7f, Polytrack); was headed in the final stride and this first crack at a sprint trip is well worth a go.

runners.name: Startling
runners.comment: Some good 5f form here & she's been shaping as though this step back up in trip will suit
runners.spotlight: Won 5f nursery here in December and kept on for third over 5f here four weeks ago; below par over C&D in December on sole previous attempt at 6f but she's been shaping as though today's trip will suit; respected.

runners.name: Captain Pickles
runners.comment: Failed to threaten in nurseries last autumn; major turnaround is needed on his AW debut
runners.spotlight: Returns from a break with his trainer enjoying a productive year but he failed to threaten last autumn in his three nurseries and a major turnaround is needed on his AW debut.

runners.name: Azuinthejungle
runners.owner: D P Van Der Hoeven & D G Pryde
runners.comment: Respectable efforts in nurseries here last autumn but needs something extra today
runners.spotlight: Performed respectably in two nurseries here (5f/6f) last autumn when last seen but he needs something extra to get off the mark today.

runners.name: Snow Creek
runners.comment: Handicap newcomer; Newmarket trainer has 3-9 record at Newcastle; interesting
runners.spotlight: Made debut in January and unable to threaten across his three starts (5f), but he showed ability on the middle outing and is open to improvement now up in trip in his first handicap, for a Newmarket trainer who has a 3-9 record at Newcastle; interesting, especially if well backed.

runners.name: Andalprofit
runners.comment: Unable to finish better than fifth across five 2yo runs; soundly beaten in both nurseries
runners.spotlight: Unable to finish better than fifth across his five 2yo runs and he was soundly beaten at Chester last September in his two nurseries (6f/7f).

runners.name: Sun Keeper
runners.comment: 6f Wolverhampton win in February and 5f runner-up here last time; could be in the mix
runners.spotlight: Headstrong sort who won at Wolverhampton (6f, AW) in February and bounced back from lesser run at Southwell when runner-up here (5f) last month in first-time cheekpieces (retained); could be in the mix.

runners.name: Hidden Verse
runners.comment: Well beaten over 7f on h'cap debut but pulled hard and could appreciate this shorter trip
runners.spotlight: Pulled hard when well beaten on recent handicap and seasonal debut at Lingfield (7f, AW); something to prove after that but he was sent off at just 4-1 and could appreciate this drop back in trip; not written off.

8:30.race_name: Win £1M With BetMGM's Golden Goals Handicap (Div II)

runners.name: Wait And Hope
runners.owner: S Rimmer, L Taylor, Mrs R Carr
runners.comment: Struggling for a while now and no encouragement in his recent return
runners.spotlight: Won on his handicap debut (Kempton, 1m) off 6lb higher for Karl Burke last year but he signed off for that yard with a poor effort and it's been a similar story for these connections, latterly when last of eight here (7f) on his return from a 198-break; well handicapped if he can rediscover some zip.

stable_tour.quote: He came here from Karl Burke's over the summer and I have to say he's been disappointing. The silver lining is that his handicap rating has dropped to 60, which could put him in with a chance at Newcastle on Thursday. 09-04-25

runners.name: Wyvern
runners.owner: Pat Morris And Clear Cut Racing
runners.comment: Good run on his penultimate start and this step back up in trip will suit
runners.spotlight: Course regular who just held on to score here in November and ran well for second (behind Coramento) in the returning visor at this track last month (both 1m); bit below that over 7f 12 days ago but will be suited by this step back up in trip.

runners.name: Just Typical
runners.comment: In good form here of late and likely to make another bold bid
runners.spotlight: Three of his four wins have come here and he's been in good form at this venue of late, two wins followed by a solid third last time (all 1m); takes a firm grip but should go well again.

runners.name: Spartan Fighter
runners.owner: John And Tony Jarvis And Partner
runners.comment: Better last time but tries this trip for the first time on his 82nd start
runners.spotlight: Seven-time course winner (6f/7f) who took a step back in the right direction last time when third of five here (7f), beaten just over 3l; tries this trip for the first time on his 82nd start.

quotes.race: Acturis Irish Stallion Farms EBF Novice Stakes (Plus 10 Race)
quotes.quote: Spartan Fighter is a nice horse. He's in the Gimcrack and I'd think it will be all geared round that. There are a couple of races in France for him but we're not in any rush, he's a horse with a future and we won't do anything hasty. He has a lot of natural ability - Declan Carroll, trainer.

runners.name: Urban Dandy
runners.comment: In good form, including here, lately and should be firmly in the mix again
runners.spotlight: Dual course winner, including over this trip, whose recent form figures of 2122 include two head defeats; beat Anif in a classified for the win and should be in the mix again.

runners.name: Coramento
runners.comment: 1-1 for a yard that's in excellent form; more to give and looks the answer
runners.spotlight: Comes from a yard in fine form and he made a winning stable/handicap debut when beating Wyvern by 1l over C&D 16 days ago; up 4lb but likely has more to offer.

runners.name: Anif
runners.comment: Veteran who can still be competitive; return to handicaps asks for a bit more though
runners.spotlight: Veteran five-time course winner who's still capable of being competitive, as he showed when second to Urban Dandy in a classified here (1m) a month ago; the return to handicaps asks for a bit more.

quotes.race: Quinnbet Second To The Favourite Apprentice Handicap
quotes.quote: Anif did it well again. The kid [Sam Feilden] gave him a lovely ride and got a great position in the race. It was perfect in the end. He clearly loves the track and that softer ground too. We don't come here often but go if we think we have a good chance of winning. That's the second one-two here this year, which is lovely - Michael Herrington, trainer.

quotes.race: Follow Sun Racing On Twitter Handicap
quotes.quote: Anif pulled up lame but hopefully he'll be okay. David [Evans] thought he'd win and he rarely gets it wrong - John Egan, jockey

runners.name: Millbuie
runners.owner: N J Dalgarno & W R Ellis
runners.comment: Unexposed on AW but difficult to know what to expect on this return from a break
runners.spotlight: Unexposed on AW after just two starts; fair second at Hamilton (about 1m, good to soft; first-time blinkers) in July but didn't build on that in two subsequent runs wearing cheekpieces; no headgear today and difficult to know what to expect on his return from a 218-day break.

runners.name: Rohilla
runners.comment: Has shown very little in seven starts and would be a surprise winner
runners.spotlight: Has shown very little in seven starts and she's readily passed over.

2:35.race_name: Spa Motors Hereford Novices' Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
2:35.going_detailed: GOOD (Good to firm in places on Chase course; watered; Chs 7.9; Hdl 7.7)

runners.name: Everyonesgame
runners.comment: Evens at Kempton (2m2f) nine days ago, perhaps about to get competitive when unseating
runners.spotlight: Very well handicapped on old hurdling form; not so hot this term, chasing on last two starts, but he was evens in a five-runner handicap at Kempton (2m2f, good) nine days ago and perhaps about to get competitive when unseating three out; has to be taken seriously in another small field today.

quotes.race: Cazoo "National Hunt" Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It's amazing what a wind operation can do. It was probably a little bit soft for  Everyonesgame today but we always thought he was nice. He's a proper decent ground horse and he'll run through some of the summer, hopefully in some nicer races. He's unexposed - Charlie Longsdon, trainer, talking to Sky Sports Racing.

stable_tour.quote: Although he has not set the world alight this season, he did win his bumper last term at Doncaster and looked a lovely young prospect. He has not lived up to expectations this autumn, but we felt an operation on his breathing could help, which he has now had. He is a fine, big, strapping horse by Jet Away, and I have always thought he would be okay. He was fifth last time at Newbury in a decent novice hurdle and, having travelled well throughout, he made a bad mistake late on which scuppered hopes. He has been given a mark of 115 and I think he could be potentially very well handicapped come the spring. 11-01-23

runners.name: The Gypsy Davey
runners.comment: Good form chance judged on most chase efforts but he keeps coming up short
runners.spotlight: 0-8 over fences, versatile regarding trip but he keeps coming up short in small fields; did so by a big margin at Chepstow (2m) on latest start, after 158 days off but he was sent off joint favourite; good form chance judged on most chase efforts.

stable_tour.quote: He's tough and genuine and, although he beat absolutely nothing in winning a maiden hurdle at Taunton and a novice at Hereford, I loved the way he went about it. He could give us some sport on spring ground, although he doesn't want it too deep. I'd say his next race will be a handicap off 112 and he'll be smashing over a fence next season. 28-02-24

runners.name: Gris Majeur
runners.breeder: G F A Du Pont Rouge
runners.comment: Dual hurdles winner here; one chase result (a February 2nd) stands out from the other four
runners.spotlight: Won twice over about 2m5f here (good) over hurdles, latterly in October; five of his seven subsequent races have been over fences, easily best of those results when close second at Ffos Las (2m3f, heavy) in February but pulled up both starts since; 3m1f may not have helped on latest.

quotes.race: Great Outdoors INH Flat Race
quotes.quote: He has settled into the routine very well and his work had been very good at home. He won a point-to-point at Fairyhouse and for this time of the year he is a bit better than them. I imagine he will go on a bit softer ground - rider Jamie Codd.

runners.name: Red Hugh
runners.comment: Point and maiden hurdle wins; off since poor handicap debut (August); could have potential
runners.spotlight: Irish maiden point winner who won a maiden hurdle at Worcester (2m7f, good) last July in clearcut style but ran poorly on handicap debut over that same C&D (also on good; 12-1) in August; off since but could bring potential to this handicap/chase debut under rules.

2:00.going_detailed: GOOD (Good to firm in places on Chase course; watered; Chs 7.9; Hdl 7.7)

runners.name: Absolutely Certain
runners.comment: 250-1 and 300-1 when beaten 70l in his two hurdle races (2m3f/2m4f)
runners.spotlight: Irish point form is nothing to crow about and he was 250-1 and 300-1 when beaten 70l in his two hurdle races (2m3f/2m4f).

runners.name: Court In A Storm

prev_owners.owner: This Horse Is For Sale Partnership

runners.comment: 2nd in bumper last April and won one by 9l at Ludlow (tongue tied) in October; big shout
runners.spotlight: Bred to jump and he showed plenty on good ground in his two bumpers when second at Huntingdon last April and winning by 9l at Ludlow (tongue tied) in October; big shout judged on that form.

stable_tour.quote: We probably won't see him again until the spring but he's won his bumper, schooled well over hurdles and I think he'll pay his way later in the season whatever happens. 19-11-24

runners.name: Don Virginia
runners.comment: Raced freely when bit below form on soft ground in December; should be a leading contender
runners.spotlight: Placed in his first three hurdle races before staying on for fourth in a handicap at Carlisle (2m1f, good to soft) in October; got loose before his next intended start (withdrawn) and raced freely when a bit below form on soft ground in December; off since but should be a leading contender.

stable_tour.quote: He was second to Listed bumper winner Kel Du Large on his debut over hurdles at Hereford in February and should have won at Warwick two runs ago when he was impeded after the last. He stayed on well at the finish on his latest run at Carlisle and is probably still a little bit weak. He'll appreciate a step up in trip and we'll look for a suitable handicap. He's only four and should improve as he strengthens up. 06-11-24

runners.name: Goodbyemick
runners.comment: 0-13 in Irish points; showed a bit of ability in two novice hurdles; tongue-tie first time
runners.spotlight: 0-13 in Irish points; showed a bit of ability in good-ground novice hurdles at Newbury and Stratford but not enough to suggest he'll be a major player in this; now tongue tied first time.

runners.name: Rock On Cowboy
runners.comment: The one to beat judged on best efforts but there have been many poor runs too
runners.spotlight: The one to beat judged on best efforts but he had a mixed time of it with Ben Pauling and, having missed the best part of two years, his third at Sedgefield (2m4f, good to soft) in February for new connections was followed by a poor show when 25-1 in a 2m7f handicap (good); cheekpieces (tried once, well beaten) return; very mixed messages.

runners.name: Sweet Serene
runners.comment: Modest form at best in three bumpers and two maiden hurdles (2m4f/2m)
runners.spotlight: Modest form at best in three bumpers and two maiden hurdles (2m4f/2m); has just her second run for this yard but no form claims.

3:10.going_detailed: GOOD (Good to firm in places on Chase course; watered; Chs 7.9; Hdl 7.7)

runners.name: Time To Dazzle
runners.comment: Second at Ludlow (2m, good to soft) in December but the rest of his chase form is poor
runners.spotlight: Respectable second at Ludlow (2m, good to soft; 10lb lower today) in December but the rest of his chase form is poor and he fell early when tried in first-time cheekpieces on latest start, which are fitted again.

runners.name: Head Over Hinds
runners.owner: Richard Bailey And S J Mattick
runners.comment: Has some ability but failed to make a serious impact in three bumpers or four hurdle races
runners.spotlight: Has some ability but failed to make a serious impact in his three bumpers and four hurdle races, the latest his handicap debut at this track (2m4f, good) when tongue tied first time; needs better on this chase debut.

runners.name: My Portia
runners.comment: Market Rasen win in January; made a bad mistake next time and bled from the nose on latest
runners.spotlight: Two good runs this winter, winning a novice handicap chase at Market Rasen (2m1f, soft; 8lb higher today) on second occasion; however, she made a bad mistake when tailed-off favourite next time and bled from the nose when pulled up on latest, so there are very mixed messages.

quotes.race: Unibet More Extra Places Than Ever Novices' Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: It was a great run by My Portia last time and I was really confident coming here today. The whole way round she jumped great and got into a nice rhythm. That has come because she was doing her racing the wrong way round as she was too free and not relaxing - Laura Morgan, trainer.

runners.name: Pittsburg
runners.comment: 4-17 chasing, with mixed form but his latest win was at Market Rasen (good) 15 days ago
runners.spotlight: 4-17 chasing, at the head of the market for wins at Uttoxeter (2m, soft) last July and Market Rasen (extended 2m1f, good) 15 days ago, latterly when produced late on by Freddie Mitchell; failed to fire in most starts in between but has to be on the shortlist.

runners.name: Tropical Talent
runners.comment: Mixed results but has won a chase; respectable Huntingdon 3rd (2m, good) three weeks ago
runners.spotlight: Narrow chase win off 1lb higher at Sedgefield (2m1f, good) last May when tongue tied for the first time; he has been beaten all starts since, with mixed results but his respectable third at Huntingdon (2m, good) three weeks ago was an encouraging return from over four months off.

runners.name: Zmiinyi
runners.comment: Unraced over a trip this short but it's worth a go and he's considered
runners.spotlight: Short-headed in a maiden point, while second on chase debut at Market Rasen (2m5f, good) in November was clearly his best result from eight races under rules; tongue tied that day and all three starts since, two of which were respectable; off more than three months before latest; unraced over a trip this short but it's worth a go and he's seriously considered.

runners.name: Fox Wallace
runners.comment: Second of six at Taunton (2m, good) 16 days ago puts her in the picture
runners.spotlight: Low-key form in her 11 starts under rules, which was still good enough for second of six at Taunton (2m, good) 16 days ago in her sixth chase and that puts her in the picture.

4:20.going_detailed: GOOD (Good to firm in places on Chase course; watered; Chs 7.9; Hdl 7.7)

runners.name: Hola Hermosa
runners.comment: Pulled up in October latest; handicap debut having changed hands and left Fergal O'Brien
runners.spotlight: Won a novice at Worcester (2m, good) last July on hurdles debut; better form in defeat next time but not seen since pulled up at Southwell later in October; makes handicap debut having changed hands and left Fergal O'Brien.

runners.name: Briery Bee
runners.comment: It's possible that she's about to show more now that she goes handicapping
runners.spotlight: Promise in bumpers last spring; respectable efforts in her first two hurdle races (wind surgery in between); no show when remote on latest but it's possible that she's about to show more now that she goes handicapping.

runners.name: Mistral Blue
runners.comment: Down the weights; more competitive under Fern O'Brien over C&D on latest outing
runners.spotlight: Won hurdle debut at Doncaster (2m3f, good) in December 2023 but a long way below that level on her six starts since; down the weights and more competitive under Fern O'Brien over C&D latest; in most circumstances she would need to improve on that but this could be a very weak race.

quotes.race: At The Races App Market Movers Mares' Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It's lovely for Mistral Blue to win, as her owners bred her; it's always great when they are able to see them all the way through. There were a lot of flights omitted, but the hurdles would have improved her, as she's a good little jumper and is very straightforward. Well done to Doncaster for getting the racing on. It was touch and go but they gave it every chance and it was a good day for us - Fergal O'Brien, trainer.

runners.name: Portobello Girl
runners.comment: More promise seemingly in bumpers last season than in her three maiden hurdles this term
runners.spotlight: More promise seemingly in bumpers last season than in her three maiden hurdles this term; ridden by Murray Dodd over hurdles; handicap debut needs to reveal her in a new light.

runners.name: Jackie Can
runners.comment: Third in a C&D maiden (good) latest brings some renewed interest to this handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Second in a bumper (good) last May and easily best effort since when third of seven in a C&D maiden (good) 15 days ago; brings some renewed interest to this handicap debut.

runners.name: Electric Annie
runners.comment: Unseated last spring in two points; first start for Ryan Potter and the market may guide
runners.spotlight: Thrown in judged on her two wins at Wincanton in winter 2021-22; well below that form since, not seen under rules since May 2023 (when pulled up) and unseating last spring in her only two point-to-points since; has her first start for Ryan Potter and needs a market check in weak race.

runners.name: My Virtue
runners.comment: Won at Southwell (2m, good) last May in tidy style; off since but could have more to offer
runners.spotlight: Off the mark over hurdles at the seventh attempt, coming from off the pace to take a ten-runner handicap at Southwell (2m, good) last May in tidy fashion under 7lb claimer; not seen since and 7lb higher today but she could have more to offer.

runners.name: Darcys Glance
runners.comment: Has shown little in her three bumpers and four hurdle races, handicap debut latest (2m6f)
runners.spotlight: Has shown little in her three bumpers and four hurdle races, latest her handicap debut (2m6f); hooded on two of her last three starts.

3:45.going_detailed: GOOD (Good to firm in places on Chase course; watered; Chs 7.9; Hdl 7.7)

runners.name: Time Interval

prev_owners.owner: P Inglett, S De Zoete And C Milln

runners.comment: Won maiden last May; his two handicaps last month were also C&D on good, second last time
runners.spotlight: Won a maiden here last May and his two handicaps last month were also over C&D on good, runner-up last time when 11l clear of the third; 4lb higher today; in the mix.

runners.name: Captain Attridge
runners.comment: August and October runs are a worry but earlier good efforts included a C&D win
runners.spotlight: Scored comfortably in another novice handicap over C&D (good) last May after a layoff and he was placed on next three outings; something amiss in a run last August and below form in first-time cheekpieces in October on his only start since, but the earlier good efforts can't be forgotten.

runners.name: Across Earth
runners.comment: Needs to jump more fluently but should bring potential to this handicap hurdle debut
runners.spotlight: Fairly useful 1m6f Flat winner for Marco Botti last July; returned from a winter break to take two minor honours over hurdles for new yard last month and coming back down from 2m3f might help; needs to jump more fluently but should bring potential to this handicap hurdle debut.

runners.name: Grenardier
runners.comment: Disappointing second favourite on handicap debut at Taunton; 2m3f might have stretched him
runners.spotlight: Best of the rest behind a long odds-on winner in Ludlow novice (2m, good to soft) in February; disappointing second favourite on handicap debut at Taunton (2m3f, good) one month ago but the trip might have stretched him.

runners.name: Rukaana
runners.comment: Fair Flat winner over 7f/1m; mostly well beaten in his five races over hurdles
runners.spotlight: Fair Flat winner over 7f/1m; mostly well beaten in his five races over hurdles, finishing closer in a handicap at Musselburgh (2m1f, good to soft) last time but nevertheless only fifth of six; others are more persuasive.

quotes.race: Conferencing And Events At Nottingham Racecourse Handicap (A Jockey Club Grassroots Mile Qualifier)
quotes.quote: I had no plan. Rukaana was a little bit slow away but he's still learning but when the penny dropped he quickened nicely. He should get plenty of confidence from coming through them like that and he's hit the line strongly. He's a big horse but coming here onto good ground suited him and I'd be confident he'd get a mile and a quarter - Christian Howarth, jockey, speaking on Racing TV.

quotes.race: Boost Your Acca With BetMGM Nursery Handicap (Div I)
quotes.quote: Rukaana is a big lad and, once I got the position I wanted to be in, I was hoping I could set sail early enough because I think he'll stay further. He showed a nice attitude going to the line.  - Ben Curtis, jockey, speaking on Sky Sports Racing.

stable_tour.quote: He came from Charlie Hills on the Flat and will be going juvenile hurdling this season. He's got a really nice attitude to jumping and hopefully he can pick up a couple of nice juvenile races. 06-11-24

runners.name: Trafalgar Square
runners.comment: Fortunate 3rd on handicap hurdle debut; tailed-off favourite when next seen 18 days ago
runners.spotlight: 0-7 on Flat and the same over hurdles; fortunate to inherit a modest third after some final-flight chaos on handicap hurdle debut at Sedgefield (2m1f, good) in November; next seen at Carlisle (2m1f, good) 18 days ago and he started favourite but tailed off; others are preferred.

5:23.race_name: Ladies Abba Evening Friday 9th May Open National Hunt Flat Race (Category 1 Elimination) (GBB Race)
5:23.going_detailed: GOOD (Good to firm in places on Chase course; watered; Chs 7.9; Hdl 7.7)

runners.name: Getaway Vic
runners.comment: Irish point winner who was first and second in bumpers at Worcester (good) last summer
runners.spotlight: Irish point winner who justified favouritism at Worcester last June on bumper debut and was a good second over that same C&D (also on good) in July; probably needs to improve again but he's a leading contender.

stable_tour.quote: He won a bumper at Worcester last summer and was then placed in another. He might have one more bumper run before the end of the season and will go novice hurdling after that. I think he should end up being a nice horse. 26-03-25

runners.name: Sinchi Roca
runners.comment: Won a good-ground point and scored in good style in a bumper on heavy at Taunton
runners.spotlight: Out of a half-sister to top-class hurdler Brave Inca; joined Tony Charlton for £70,000 after winning a good-ground point in December and scored in good style in a six-runner bumper at Taunton (heavy) in February; others in the latter race had form and that was a bright start.

runners.name: Gimarias
runners.owner: Exors Of The Late Mr A Rutherford

prev_owners.owner: Exors Of The Late Mr A Rutherford

runners.comment: Down the field when 66-1 at Exeter (2m, heavy) in February; the market can guide again
runners.spotlight: Down the field when 66-1 at Exeter (2m, heavy) in February; the market can guide again.

runners.name: Java Jackie
runners.comment: 80-1, no show at Warwick (good) two weeks ago
runners.spotlight: 80-1, no show at Warwick (good) two weeks ago.

runners.name: Mighty Gesture
runners.comment: Second of five in a modest contest at Catterick (good) in November but should improve
runners.spotlight: 6-4 favourite and tongue tied, no threat to the winner when staying-on second of five in what looked a modest contest at Catterick (good) in November, but she's open to improvement for stable that makes its mark in bumpers.

runners.name: Lovis De Sceaux
runners.breeder: S C E A Ecurie Haras De La Rousseliere
runners.comment: Trainer has won bumpers this term but this 4yo was eighth of 12 at Doncaster (good; 22-1)
runners.spotlight: Trainer has won bumpers this season but this 4yo faded into 15l eighth of 12 when 22-1 at Doncaster (good) early last month.

runners.name: Miz Klimt
runners.comment: 200-1, pressed the leader for a long way at Huntingdon (good) before ending seventh of 12
runners.spotlight: Flat bred; 200-1, pressed the leader for a long way at Huntingdon (good) three weeks ago before ending up seventh of 12; work to do.

runners.name: Windsor Blue
runners.comment: Well related and a newcomer to note
runners.spotlight: Third foal; dam well held in bumpers, sister to bumper and useful staying hurdle/chase winner Cogry, half-sister to useful 2m5f hurdle/2m7f chase winner Malinello, out of sister to smart bumper/2m-3m1f hurdle winner Marello; newcomer to note.

4:53.going_detailed: GOOD (Good to firm in places on Chase course; watered; Chs 7.9; Hdl 7.7)

runners.name: King Of Brazil
runners.comment: 2-13 over fences, with the wins over about 2m4f in the mud last February and March
runners.spotlight: 2-13 over fences, with the wins over about 2m4f in the mud last February and March; second off a career-low mark at Lingfield (2m, soft) this February, followed by a respectable show in first-time cheekpieces, but today's trip and forecast good ground both ask major questions.

quotes.race: Winvic Construction Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: King Of Brazil made hard work of it but he outstayed them really. It's getting quite slow out there now - Gavid Sheehan, jockey.

runners.name: Mistymal
runners.comment: Won chase/seasonal debut over C&D (good) and close third next time; two lesser shows since
runners.spotlight: Won on his chase/seasonal debut over C&D (good) in October and close third next time; also effective on good to soft; his two performances since are off-putting, the good to soft ground notwithstanding, but he'd be competitive if reverting to those earlier peak efforts.

stable_tour.quote: He's an ex-Irish point-to-pointer. He looked a nice prospect and ran with credit at Southwell two starts ago, but he couldn't handle Fakenham last time. He wants better ground and a big, galloping track and I'd be gutted if he can't win races for us. 20-03-24

runners.name: Cave Article
runners.comment: Should be on the premises if the first-time cheekpieces don't have an adverse effect
runners.spotlight: Chasing on last four starts, with a win at Sedgefield (extended 3m2f, soft) in December; solid third in his two starts since, the latest on good ground, and he should be on the premises if the first-time cheekpieces don't have an adverse effect; stable also runs Side Stepper.

quotes.race: Cleveland Systems Engineering Christmas Jumpers Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Cave Article is raw and found the ground a bit tiring, a bit sticky - Brian Hughes, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Ultra Viers
runners.comment: 1-7 in points and 0-17 under rules; remains unconvincing
runners.spotlight: 1-7 in points and 0-17 under rules; going down by 10l at Fontwell (3m2f, good; fourth of seven) last time was his closest finish in a handicap but he remains unconvincing.

runners.name: Hey Bud

runners.comment: 12yo whose sole win (27 races) came over hurdles in 2019
runners.spotlight: 12yo whose sole win (27 races) came over hurdles in 2019 and he's been well held over fences for over two years now.

runners.name: Side Stepper
runners.comment: Tailed off on chase debut but that was over a shorter trip; more interesting today
runners.spotlight: Tailed off on chase debut last month but that was over an extended 2m3f, always behind and with something clearly to learn, whereas he was third in handicap hurdles last summer over 3m3f and 3m, ridden prominently; lightly raced 6yo who could step up a gear again now that he's returned to a staying trip; stable also runs Cave Article.

4:30.going_detailed: GOOD (Good to firm in places; watered; 7.3)

runners.name: Lord Baddesley
runners.comment: Good 4th at Newbury (2m4f) in November; this is a welcome lowering of his sights
runners.spotlight: Best run for new yard when fourth from the front at Newbury (2m4f, good to soft; acts well on good) in November and he'll be suited by the return to this trip after a minor 3m2f effort at Doncaster in March; acts well on sharp tracks and this is a welcome lowering of his sights.

quotes.race: Irish Thoroughbred Marketing Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We ran Lord Baddesley at Cheltenham and he unseated and then his head went a bit, so it's great to get him back here - on a decent-galloping track and nice bit of ground. He still got quite hot coming here and is still quite a big, buzzy creature, but during the race he did it well, which is the main thing. He won't have a hard time and we might call it a day for the season, although we could have a look at another one. He'll be a lovely chaser next season - Chris Gordon, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: We didn't learn much about him in the Badger Beer. We're not sure whether to aim low or high yet - there's a few ideas, but he's probably due a win and I can see him landing a nice pot this season. 14-11-24

We are now buying nicer young horses and this fellow is typical of that type of individual. Following two encouraging bumper efforts last season he made a winning debut over hurdles this season at Fontwell. He raced very clean and deliberate, which maybe cost him the odd length early on but as he warmed up he became very slick. There is an EBF qualifier at Wincanton coming up that I would like to run him in as it is over 2m which is his trip. If we can get him in the first four then it gives us another string to our bow at the end of the season. I will be minding this fellow this season as it will be when he goes chasing next year he will really start to show his strengths. 11-11-20

runners.name: Investment Manager
runners.comment: Course specialist who won 3m2f chase and hurdle here in 2024; not ruled out back here
runners.spotlight: Often leads; course specialist who added two more wins to his haul in 2024, at 3m2f over fences and hurdles (both on soft; has won on good); rare to see him run over this short a trip now but he can't be dismissed back on this track.

stable_tour.quote: He's been in excellent form and we're going to look at regional Nationals for him, maybe at Plumpton or the Devon National at Exeter. It'd be good to have a dabble at those long-distance races as he travels well through his races. The wind op this year has got him going and he's been very consistent with it. 10-11-23

runners.name: Jaramillo
runners.comment: Just two chase runs; no match for winner latest (2m4f, good) but may yet do better
runners.spotlight: He'd had plenty of racing in other disciplines before switching to fences but he jumped well in the main when following home an odds-on shot at Wincanton (2m4f, good) on second chase start; will be suited by going this way round and may yet do better.

stable_tour.quote: A very quirky individual who has done well for us. He hasn't run for ages because he doesn't like soft ground but hopefully he'll be out in the spring. He took well to a bit of schooling over fences and he ran really well at Southwell in December. He'll do very well when the ground dries up. He's got a lot of class. 05-03-25

2:10.going_detailed: GOOD (Good to firm in places; watered; 7.3)

runners.name: Yes Indeed
runners.comment: Comfortable winner on stable debut last month; 6lb rise may not be enough to stop a repeat
runners.spotlight: Made the perfect start for this yard, following 252-day break, when significantly down in trip to score off a career-low mark at Stratford (2m1f, good to soft) a month ago; back up 6lb but won comfortably that day and his peak mark was another 24lb higher, so he could be the type to build back up.

stable_tour.quote: It was a respectable run in a fair race at Carlisle the other day. He jumped nicely and did everything right. Perhaps a flatter track might suit better but I wouldn't be afraid to run him anywhere and that run gives us something to build on. 14-11-23

runners.name: Famoso

prev_owners.owner: P K Barber And P J Vogt

runners.comment: Back on track last time and this tight venue should suit; should go well
runners.spotlight: Completed a hat-trick when winning at Ludlow (2m, good to soft) in December and he got back on track, after some lesser efforts, when third at that venue (2m, good; Dexter fourth) three weeks ago; tight tracks suit and he should go well on this first visit to Newton Abbot.

quotes.race: Matt Sheppard Slow Two Miler Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: It was a career-best performance from Famoso and Stan [Sheppard] gave him a blinding ride. He's very well bred and probably has far more ability than he lets on, but he put it all together on the right day - Matt Sheppard, trainer.

quotes.race: NFU Mutual Novices' Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Famoso is a joy to train and he's very straightforward. He travelled into the race very strongly and I couldn't be happier with what he did. He'll be going to Ludlow as much as possible as he needs a sharp track. He disappointed at Exeter last time and Warwick too this season, which are galloping tracks, whereas his best runs have come here and at Stratford - Matt Shepherd, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He started 8-11 favourite for a Chepstow bumper but disappointed us. I think he'll leave that form well behind and I'm now going to get him going over hurdles because I think he wants a trip. 16-11-20

He's been in great form. He did us proud when winning the Matt Sheppard Slow Two-Miler Handicap Chase at Hereford on the day of my book launch. He won at Ludlow off 81 last November and his win at Hereford this November was off 97, so he's done really well. He then ran at Wincanton last Thursday, running and winning off a career-high mark of 102 under Richard Patrick. I was a bit worried that the ground might have been a bit soft for him but he's never failed to surprise me. Wincanton proved to me that the better the class of race, the better he might run, and he did it quite cosily in the end. He'll go to either Ludlow or Hereford on December 18 or 21, whichever one looks best at the time. He's a half-brother to the King George winner Tornado Flyer. 28-11-24

runners.name: Dexter

prev_owners.owner: Exors Of The Late C J Leech

runners.comment: Shaped encouragingly on last month's return from a 556-day break; can do better
runners.spotlight: Flat, hurdle and chase winner in France but his losing spell goes back to 2021; 0-6 for current yard but he'd been absent for 556 days before last month's return at Ludlow (2m, good; Famoso third) and didn't shape at all badly, despite finishing last of the four to complete; raced rather freely that day too and may well take a step forward.

quotes.race: DragonBet: Oncourse And Online Conditional Jockeys' Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: I must say a big thank-you to Sean Bowen, who rode Musique De Fee six days ago. I rang him this morning and all he said was to kick on with her and he was right - Finn Lambert, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

He came back from that a mess and so it's taken until now to get him back right. Harry (Reed)'s done a lot with him at home - Daisy Hitchins, trainer, speaking to Sky Racing.

runners.spotlight: Has form over C&D but has never won away from Wolverhampton; below par there last time, ending a consistent spell; not the percentage call.
