runners.spotlight: Campaigned in Class 6 events at Wolverhampton since December; form dipped last time; others preferred in this scenario.

runners.name: Kapparis Kid
runners.comment: Mixed results for new yard; still seeking first handicap win
runners.spotlight: Mixed results in Class 6 contests at Wolverhampton for new yard; still seeking first handicap win; opposed.

2:27.race_name: £30 In Free Bets With BetUK Restricted Novice Stakes (For horses In Bands B, C And D) (GBB Race)

runners.name: Maraaheb
runners.comment: Out of 1m4f Listed winner; 28-1 for recent AW debut and promising effort in 4th
runners.spotlight: Out of 1m4f Listed winner in France; hooded, as today, for recent Wolverhampton debut at about 1m1f, where he was very weak in the market for a competitive novice but, despite racing freely, he kept on steadily into fourth; should improve for the step up in trip; major contender.

runners.name: Jack Langley
runners.comment: Triple-figure prices and never showed in AW maidens at 1m and 1m4f; handicaps soon
runners.spotlight: Triple-figure prices and he never showed in Kempton maidens at 1m and 1m4f; bearing down on ordinary handicaps soon.

runners.name: Lesson Of Life
runners.comment: Late headway before flattening over 1m on debut; faded after front-running at 1m1f after
runners.spotlight: Dam bred two who stayed well; contrasting tactics in two AW runs as 2yo, making late headway before effort flattened out over 1m at Kempton, then made the running and faded at Wolverhampton (extended 1m1f; favourite); a lot depends on how she's come on over the winter.

runners.name: Rommie The Miracle
runners.comment: 20-1, ran green and never showed with a chance on C&D debut (beaten 20l) in March
runners.spotlight: 20-1, ran green and never entered the equation on C&D debut (beaten 20l) in March.

runners.name: Baby Caitlin
runners.comment: 15,000gns yearling; will do well to topple those with experience
runners.spotlight: 15,000gns yearling; third foal; by Churchill; dam placed 7f 2yo (RPR 74), sister to 1m3f/13.7f winner Frosty The Snowman, half-sister to 6f 2yo winner Vallambrosa; will do very well to topple those with experience.

runners.name: Harpsichord
runners.comment: Well-connected filly; promising 4th to stablemate on 1m debut at Southwell; improve
runners.spotlight: Well-connected filly whose sibling Siskany was a multiple Listed/Graded/Group winner over 1m4f-2m at home and abroad; was slowly away on 1m Southwell debut in December but there was plenty to like about her fourth to a better-fancied stablemate; looks sure to do better now up in trip.

3:37.race_name: Win £1M With BetMGM's Golden Goals Restricted Maiden Fillies' Stakes (Bands B, C & D) (GBB)

runners.name: Cupola
runners.comment: Strong-finishing third over C&D, then had excuses at Wolverhampton; interesting back here
runners.spotlight: Finished strongly for close third of eight over C&D, then had excuses (wide trip; perhaps less suited by Tapeta) at Wolverhampton; remains open to progress and looks interesting back here.

runners.name: Havana Joy
runners.comment: Form figures of 322 reflect a consistent start to her career; thereabouts again
runners.spotlight: Form figures of 322 reflect a consistent start to her career, in 6f/7f races at Kempton/Wolverhampton; thereabouts again, provided she's as effective at this venue.

runners.name: Pure Imagination
runners.comment: Brings the worst form
runners.spotlight: Brings the worst form and is likely to find better opportunities in handicaps shortly.

runners.name: Unbinding
runners.comment: 15,000gns yearling; by Iffraaj; looks the better of the two newcomers
runners.spotlight: 15,000gns yearling; by Iffraaj out of a maiden sister to 5f-6f winner Under Curfew and half-sister to 5f 2yo Listed winner Dijarvo; looks the better of the two newcomers.

runners.name: Bonnita
runners.owner: G E Bassett & P R Chamings
runners.comment: 4,000gns foal; yard not typically associated with debut scorers
runners.spotlight: 4,000gns foal; sister to 7f/1m 2yo winner Queen's Eyot (RPR 82), half-sister to prolific 5f/6f winner Lihou (including AW 2yo; 96); yard not typically noted for debut scorers.

runners.name: Stylish Affair
runners.comment: Needs to show improvement on debut for new connections
runners.spotlight: Hinted at ability in the first of two autumn starts for Charles Hills but needs to show improvement; sold for 5,500gns in November then 1,200gns in December.

runners.name: Annsar
runners.comment: Promising third of 13 over 7f at Kempton, faring best of the newcomers; leading player
runners.spotlight: Promising third of 13 in 7f contest at Kempton six months ago, faring best of the newcomers; leading player, provided she copes with drop in trip (mixed messages in pedigree).

4:45.race_name: Free Bets With BetUK Bet Club Handicap

runners.name: Harb
runners.breeder: Boyce Bloodstock & Mrs C E Percival
runners.comment: Close third behind Midnightattheoasis and Recon Mission at this venue last week
runners.spotlight: Dual C&D winner; close third behind Midnightattheoasis and Recon Mission at this venue last week; enters calculations.

quotes.race: Amazing Sri Lanka Handicap (A Jockey Club Grassroots Series Sprint Qualifier)
quotes.quote: I'd love to say this was the plan, but it was more to have a run and then bring him back to the race he won last year. I knew he was pretty sharp, on Monday he dropped our lad who rides him every day and galloped round the field like a good'un, which gave him that last piece of work in a way. I said to his owner the morning, 'Don't think this horse hasn't got a chance', because he was as fit as I could get him at this stage. Sure enough, he's shown that. Harb is wonderful, I love him to bits, but I've also got another horse I'm really excited about called Harry Brown. I've got really high hopes for later in the year - Peter Crate, trainer.

quotes.race: Racing TV Profits Returned To Racing Handicap
quotes.quote: Harb has had a bit of a break as we thought he needed it and Peter said about running here so I said 'go on' and he has done it well. When Tom (Queally, jockey) got off him at Epsom he said we should try a mile - there was no way on God's earth he was going to get it, but you have to listen to the likes of Tom and give the horse a chance.I actually walked away as everywhere he was going he was getting blocked in, but he has ended up doing that well - Pat Gallagher, owner.

stable_tour.quote: Has been working well and will run soon, 18-04-21

runners.name: Coolagh Magic
runners.owner: Lady Emma Oshea And A Carson
runners.comment: Met traffic issues here last week but current mark is difficult
runners.spotlight: Five course wins; met traffic issues when behind three of these opponents here last week but current mark is difficult.

quotes.race: Ladbrokes Home Of The Odds Boost Handicap
quotes.quote: Coolagh Magic jumped out well and when I asked for a change of gear, he'd gone. He's always worked quite well and is probably getting quicker, having won over five here - Tony Hamilton, rider.

stable_tour.quote: He only came to us this summer and I deliberately didn't rush him. I thought he would go well first time out at Lingfield earlier this month but it was a pleasant surprise to see him come home in front. In his younger days he had won off a loftier mark, but he has been working well and I expect him to go on from here. 15-09-21

runners.name: Midnightattheoasis
runners.comment: Beat four of these rivals over C&D nine days ago, completing a four-timer; thriving
runners.spotlight: Got up close home to beat four of these rivals over C&D nine days ago, completing a four-timer; thriving and warrants respect.

quotes.race: BetUK: It's Where The UK Bets Handicap
quotes.quote: Rossa [Ryan] has clicked with him and that was an unbelievable ride he gave Midnightattheoasis. I was worried about him going down the hill and that played out in the race, but luckily Rossa switched him inside round the bend and that galvanised him. The drop back to five has worked a treat. He travels very strongly and we ran him a lot over six furlongs but I'll hold my hands up and say that was trainer error. It was more by accident we popped him in at Wolverhampton two weeks ago but we've found the key to him now. He'll still only be off 61 [at Chelmsford next Thursday], and he was rated 70 at one point. We're lucky to have plenty of turnout and he won't have the tack on him until he goes to Chelmsford, which works well for these sprinters - Phil McEntee, trainer.

runners.name: Micks Spirit
runners.comment: Finished behind four of these opponents here last week (slowly away)
runners.spotlight: Multiple C&D scorer but needs to rebound, having finished behind four of these opponents last week (slowly away).

quotes.race: Gamble Responsibly At BetUK Handicap
quotes.quote: We backed Mick's Spirit at 28s. I couldn't believe he kept drifting so it's wonderful. I haven't had him in such good form since the last time he won - Conrad Allen, trainer, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

quotes.race: Betway Novice Stakes
quotes.quote: Mick's Spirit was very fizzy early on but he's learnt to settle. We took the hood off today, dropped him back to five furlongs and he won quite nicely. We're really happy with him and he should have a future in handicaps - Conrad Allen, trainer.

runners.name: Recon Mission
runners.comment: On a long losing spell but is better off with Midnightattheoasis on C&D form last week
runners.spotlight: On a long losing spell but is better off with Midnightattheoasis on C&D form last week and due to go back up 2lb in future; good chance.

quotes.race: Oxshott Handicap
quotes.quote: I wasn't sure (if I'd held on) but the second horse just gave me a nudge towards the line and with these older sprinters, it has probably helped me more than anything as he'd just got a little bit lonely in front. He was hanging left towards the stands and I just needed a bit of company towards the line - Tom Marquand, jockey.

quotes.race: Terry Mills Handicap
quotes.quote: Recon Mission has been unlucky in a couple of runs, but the small field suited and he's won here before. He's had a long old season and you can't keep going with these horses, so he won't have too many more races before a break. He'll be back here next year for the Dash - Brian Millen, owner.

quotes.race: Epsom Downs Welcomes Back Owners Handicap
quotes.quote: Recon Mission had run well here previously in the Dash and this was a step on the way back to that race. He'll probably go straight there now. We've run him over six furlongs and tried to hang on to him but he didn't enjoy it as he likes to roll - Tony Carroll, trainer.

quotes.race: Pavers Foundation Catherine Memorial Sprint Handicap
quotes.quote: Recon Mission is a very talented horse who likes it in front. The ground is very important for him as he needs a bit of cut. There are options in France and Ireland and he could be one for the Ayr Gold Cup later in the season - Tony Carroll, trainer.

quotes.race: Become A Member At Fairyhouse Nursery Handicap (Plus 10 Race)
quotes.quote: He's a lovely horse. There's another nursery for him in a few weeks but the handicapper might be hard enough on him after winning by three lengths. There is also a Listed race over 5f in a few weeks for him as well so we might go for that - Michael O'Callaghan, trainer

runners.name: Rebel Star
runners.comment: Has form figures of 222 since wearing a visor; threatening to win a race of this nature
runners.spotlight: Seven-race maiden; has form figures of 222 since wearing visor and is better off with Midnightattheoasis on C&D running in March; again went very close last Thursday, at Chelmsford; threatening to win a race of this nature.

runners.name: Street Life
runners.owner: Pat Morris And Clear Cut Racing
runners.comment: Bounced back at Wolverhampton last month, finishing second to Midnightattheoasis
runners.spotlight: Bounced back at Wolverhampton last month, finishing second to Midnightattheoasis who was on first leg of four-timer; not ruled out.

quotes.race: Sky Bet Sunday Apprentice Training Series Handicap (Part Of The Racing Excellence Initiative)
quotes.quote: I let Street Life bowl along and as soon as I asked him, he just took off. Last time I rode him, he missed the break and it was game over. He was a lot more relaxed in the stalls - Morgan Cole, rider.

quotes.race: Ladbrokes Where The Nation Plays Handicap
quotes.quote: He has done it well. STREET LIFE was away really well and jumped the best of them. He travelled as well, whereas before he was always lazy in his racing. He put it to bed well - Sean Davis, jockey

runners.name: Battle Point
runners.comment: Made all in this race two years ago but that's his only win in 34 starts
runners.spotlight: Made all in this race two years ago but that's his only success in 34 starts; behind two of these rivals here last time.

runners.name: Northern Blaze
runners.owner: M Webber, M T Ward & Schiff Family

prev_owners.owner: M Webber, M T Ward & Schiff Family

runners.comment: Hindered by wide trip on handicap debut when last seen; remains open to improvement
runners.spotlight: Prominent in betting for handicap debut when last seen, only to be hindered by wide trip in that Kempton event; remains open to improvement at this level; shortlisted.

runners.name: Eva Dickson
runners.comment: Six-race maiden; related to several winners for her connections; may still do better
runners.spotlight: Six-race maiden who has bits of encouraging form; disappointing last time but is related to several winners for her connections and may still do better; remains of interest at this sort of level.

runners.name: Its Life
runners.comment: Handicap debutante who is far from solid on her 2yo form
runners.spotlight: Handicap debutante who is far from solid on her 2yo form and has been absent for ten months; best watched unless the market speaks favourably.

runners.name: Dandy Khan
runners.comment: Ex-Irish maiden; ran as if something was amiss here on debut for new yard
runners.spotlight: Ex-Irish maiden who ran as if something was amiss at this course (6f) two months ago for new yard; the betting may prove best guide to expectations.

runners.name: Skyelight
runners.comment: Showed promise switched to handicap level last autumn; may progress this year
runners.spotlight: Showed promise switched to handicap level last autumn, placed at Wolverhampton (8.5f) latest occasion; may be capable of progress this year; one to consider.

runners.name: Spoilt
runners.comment: Improvement over 7f here the last twice, while shaping as if return to 1m will suit
runners.spotlight: Showed improvement over 7f here (maiden/handicap) the last twice, making the frame both times, while shaping as if this return to 1m will suit; possibilities.

runners.name: Backer Bilk
runners.comment: Record of 2123 since handicapping; respected, assuming he takes well to the headgear
runners.spotlight: Record of 2123 (over 8.5f/1m2f) since handicapping, the win at this course; proving consistent and he's the only runner in this field who isn't a maiden; respected, assuming he takes well to first-time headgear.

runners.name: Muy Muy Loco
runners.comment: Three duck eggs next to his name but may do better now qualified for handicaps
runners.spotlight: Has three duck eggs next to his name but hinted at improvement (beaten just under 7l) here most recently; could have something better to offer in handicaps.

runners.name: Boundless Poet

prev_owners.owner: C Wade, J Bonner And Partners

runners.comment: Failed to progress for Ollie Sangster; sold for 1,000gns since last run
runners.spotlight: Failed to progress for Ollie Sangster, latterly in handicaps; sold for 1,000gns since last run; opposed unless the market suggests otherwise.

runners.name: Sharma Damour
runners.comment: Ran encouragingly in C&D maiden on reappearance; interesting handicap debutante
runners.spotlight: Ran encouragingly in C&D maiden on seasonal debut; may take another step forward now handicapping; interesting, especially if the betting speaks positively.

runners.name: Woodhay Whisper
runners.comment: Still a maiden but went close at Wolverhampton last time and remains unexposed over 6f
runners.spotlight: Still a maiden but went close in reapplied hood at Wolverhampton (6f) most recently and remains unexposed over this distance; possibilities in the retained headgear.

runners.name: Rock Master
runners.comment: Gelded prior to running well at Chelmsford on reappearance; may well build on that effort
runners.spotlight: Gelded prior to running well in first-time cheekpieces at Chelmsford (6f) on reappearance and may build on that effort; now goes in blinkers; enters calculations.

runners.name: Ancient State
runners.comment: Justified support at Wolverhampton last month; open to further progress at this level
runners.spotlight: Justified market support in first-time tongue-tie at Wolverhampton (5f) last month and is open to further progress at this level; should be as effective back at 6f; respected.

runners.name: Royal Accord
runners.comment: Good second at Bath last week; due to go back up 1lb in future; could well go one better
runners.spotlight: Maiden who has steadily found his form this year for new stable, most recently runner-up at Bath (5.7f) last week; due to go back up 1lb in future; could well go one better.

runners.name: Sarabi
runners.comment: Something to find on form but Rossa Ryan is a positive booking; new stable
runners.spotlight: 0-5 for Jack Channon; sold for 2,000gns since last run; has something to find on bare form but Rossa Ryan is a positive booking; market support should be noted.

runners.name: Top Biller
runners.comment: Regressed the last twice; needs a turnaround on debut for new yard
runners.spotlight: Took well to first-time blinkers at Wolverhampton (6f) in January but regressed the last twice; sold out of Jamie Osborne's yard for 3,000gns since; others preferred.

runners.name: Sunny Time
runners.comment: Has a record of 1-1 at this venue; however, has shown best form over 5f
runners.spotlight: Sole attempt at Lingfield resulted in his only win (three runs ago); however, has shown best form over 5f and this step back up in trip presents a question mark.

runners.name: Hala Joza
runners.comment: Needs to build on latest effort; yet to make the frame
runners.spotlight: Five-race maiden; showed some promise at Wolverhampton (6f) most recently but needs to build on that effort; yet to make the frame.

runners.name: Shes A Dark Horse
runners.comment: Chance of opening her account depends on how well she responds to the hood
runners.spotlight: Has consistent RPRs since handicapping but the standard is meagre; chance of opening her account depends on how well she responds to first-time hood.

runners.name: Bluesy Moon
runners.comment: Very weak claims on form; headgear fitted
runners.spotlight: Holds very weak claims on her 2yo form; first-time headgear needs to make a big difference on reappearance.

2:17.going_detailed: GOOD (Good to yielding in places; watered)

runners.name: Atlantic City
runners.comment: Promise when 12l third at Fairyhouse (heavy), place chance if handles ground; cheekpieces
runners.spotlight: Dual-purpose; 0-2 over hurdles and 0-2 on the Flat; has shown promise, including when a 12.5l third in a 2m Fairyhouse maiden latest, though that was on heavy ground; untried on good, place chance if handles it in first-time cheekpieces.

runners.name: Game Phoenix
runners.owner: Mrs B Power & John J Phelan
runners.comment: Dual-purpose, rated 102, promise in maidens at Killarney & Fairyhouse, place chance if fit
runners.spotlight: Dual-purpose; 0-5 over hurdles and rated 102; runner-up in maidens at Killarney last August and Fairyhouse in November on nice ground; poor effort in first-time hood (retained) when last seen in November but ground was soft; place claims if fit for return.

runners.name: Guess What
runners.comment: Walk In The Park filly, dam 2m3f winner from family of Native Upmanship, check market
runners.spotlight: One of two for yard; Walk In The Park filly is a first foal; dam 2m3f hurdle winner, half-sister to winners Gilgamboa (high-class 2m-3m hurdle/chase) and Stealthy Tom (useful 2m4f-3m1f chase), out of unraced sister to high-class jumper Native Upmanship; worth a market check on debut.

runners.name: Janes Harbour
runners.comment: 0-4 over hurdles and rated 109, good effort in a h'cap latest, preferred by Walsh, claims
runners.spotlight: 0-4 over hurdles and rated 109; beaten 2l off 105 in a Fairyhouse handicap on return from 122-day break in February; went close in a maiden at Cork in October (2m, good); preferred by Mark Walsh and sets the standard.

runners.name: Kentucky Bluebird
runners.comment: 0-2, pulled up on debut at Gowran, beaten 41l at Naas latest when 50-1, may need more time
runners.spotlight: 0-2 over hurdles; pulled up on debut at Gowran and beaten 41l at Naas when a 50-1 shot; may need more time.

runners.name: Kick On Nellie
runners.comment: Elusive Pimpernel filly, dam won at 2m-2m4f, probably best watched unless backed
runners.spotlight: Elusive Pimpernel filly is a first foal; dam 2m-2m4f hurdle winner, half-sister to winners Torygraph (useful 2m7f hurdle), Thunder (2m6f hurdle) and Presenting Mahler (bumper and 2m-2m4f hurdle/chase), out of point winner; probably best watched on debut unless money comes.

runners.name: Ladys Choice
runners.comment: Fell both starts in points, sister won a 2m3f chase for this yard, watch on rules debut
runners.spotlight: Affinisea filly fell in both point-to-point starts at Borris House and Ballyragget; sister won a 2m3f chase for this yard; best watched on rules debut.

runners.name: Preparations
runners.comment: Flat winner off 64 at Bellewstown, worth monitoring in the market on hurdles debut
runners.spotlight: Flat winner off 64 at Bellewstown (1m4f, yielding) when last seen in October; interesting recruit to hurdling and she is worth monitoring closely in the market on her return from a 189-day absence.

runners.name: Rhythm Of Life
runners.breeder: E A R L Elevage Des Loges
runners.comment: Promise on heavy on debut, pedigree suggests good ground might suit, claims for top yard
runners.spotlight: Sent off at 5-1 for her hurdles debut at Navan (2m, heavy) and finished fifth of 12, beaten 17.5l; her half-sister ran big race on nice ground in the Champion Bumper last month so she should be effective on this sounder surface; claims for leading yard.

runners.name: Samba Train
runners.comment: Blue Bresil filly, half-sister to two winners, dam won over 2m4f, worth a market check
runners.spotlight: Blue Bresil filly is a sixth foal; half-sister to winners Lady Chuffnell (2m hurdle) and Femme Magnifique (bumper/2m3f hurdle); dam 2m4f hurdle winner, closely related to high-class bumper and 2m-2m5f hurdle/chase winner Oscar Whiskey; nicely bred and worth a market check on debut.

runners.name: Wild Wild Wind
runners.comment: Jet Away filly, dam won over 1m1f on the Flat, limited appeal on breeding, best watched
runners.spotlight: Daughter of Jet Away is a second foal; dam 1m1f winner (RPR 93), sister to 1m winner Miracles In May, out of maiden close relative of Italian 1m1f 2yo Group 2 winner Mistero; limited appeal on breeding and best watched.

2:52.going_detailed: GOOD (Good to yielding in places; watered)

runners.name: Mujeres Isla
runners.comment: No show in first two h'caps, down in grade and tongue-tie now tried, hard to fancy
runners.spotlight: Hasn't yet built on the promise he showed when fifth at Cork in his third maiden start; down 6lb and drops in grade after two poor efforts in handicaps; tongue-tie is now tried; hard to make a case for.

runners.name: Tingarran Express
runners.comment: Up 5lb for 5.5l win at Clonmel, drop back to 2m fine but previous course form a worry
runners.spotlight: 2-29 over hurdles, that second win coming by 5.5l off 95 at Clonmel (18.5f, good) two weeks ago; 5lb rise for that seems fair and the drop to 2m is fine but she hasn't produced her best in four previous runs at this venue.

runners.name: Phoenix Cowboy
runners.comment: Placed here over 19.5f off 12lb higher last May, 2m may be too sharp, place claims
runners.spotlight: Three-time Flat winner (rated 90) is 0-17 over hurdles; has run well at this venue before, including a 0.75l second off 109 over 19.5f last May; now rated 97 so well treated on that form but 2m might be a bit sharp for him on the evidence of his latest run at Cork (Who's In Midfield 0.5l behind); place claims.

quotes.race: McEnery Cup Handicap
quotes.quote: Phoenix Cowboy is a horse that we thought wanted plenty of cut but he loved that ground. He will get further and hopefully get into a premier handicap now - Shane Lyons, assistant trainer.

runners.name: Makfils
runners.comment: 1-26 over hurdles, now just 1lb above last win, 2m fine, can't be discounted
runners.spotlight: 1-26 over hurdles, that win coming for Peter Fahey at Punchestown (2m, good to yielding) last May off 92; no impact in first two runs for this yard but is now down to just 1lb above last winning mark and he has run well here before; don't discount.

quotes.race: Summer In Town 8th & 9th June Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Makfils was off a low mark today and was good after a break. He travelled well, never missed a beat jumping and he loved the ground - Jake Coen, rider.

runners.name: Splendid Choice
runners.comment: Not a terrible run at Clonmel latest, drops to 2m, cheekpieces return, others preferred
runners.spotlight: Has shown brief glimmers of promise but overall his form is poor; wasn't a terrible run at Clonmel on latest but was still beaten 13.5l; down 1lb, drops back to 2m and cheekpieces return, though they haven't done much for him before; others preferred.

runners.name: Midnight Eagle
runners.comment: 0-7 over hurdles, ran better than result suggests here latest, down in trip, outrun odds
runners.spotlight: 0-7 over hurdles; ran better than the distance she was beaten suggests over 2m3f (good) here latest; worth another try at 2m on that evidence and has been dropped 4lb; could outrun her likely odds.

runners.name: Whos In Midfield
runners.comment: 0-6, promise in first two h'caps, closely matched with Phoenix Cowboy, could go well
runners.spotlight: 0-6 over hurdles but has shown definite promise in first two handicaps; fourth of 18 on latest at Cork (16.5f, good), beaten 9.75l for the win but just 0.5l behind Phoenix Cowboy; could go well.

runners.name: Old Kenmare
runners.comment: Mild promise in maidens, remote third behind Tingarran Express latest, needs more
runners.spotlight: Mild promise in maidens at 2m-2m3f on yielding to soft and heavy ground; finished a remote third behind Tingarran Express on latest at Clonmel (18.5f, good); raced keenly that day so may do better dropped back in trip but needs more to get his head in front.

runners.name: Sea The Sunset
runners.comment: Won off this mark in October 2023, lightly raced since, hasn't shown enough in recent runs
runners.spotlight: Dual-purpose; gained first win in a Downpatrick handicap hurdle in October 2023 off 86; lightly raced since and hasn't looked like adding to his tally; handicapper giving him a chance but he hasn't shown enough in recent starts.

runners.name: Navy Waves
runners.comment: No win since 2022, shaped well on penultimate, place claims if he can repeat that
runners.spotlight: Thurles maiden win in November 2022 his sole victory to date; has run well in defeat in handicaps, including on penultimate when beaten 2.25l at Thurles (15.5f, good to yielding); not as good latest over 2m4f at Down Royal; if he repeats his Thurles effort he has place claims.

quotes.race: Templemore Mares Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Navy Waves is only a small filly. I had to sit and suffer but it opened up on the inner and she plugged away - Evan Dwan, rider.

runners.name: Cramers Valley
runners.comment: Had a couple of these behind at Cork latest, 5lb rise seems harsh but he has a chance
runners.spotlight: Had a couple of these behind on latest when finishing a 3.25l second at Cork under a positive ride; 2m on good ground is fine for him but a 5lb rise for that last run seems a bit harsh; still has a chance, nonetheless.

runners.name: Added Bonus
runners.comment: Two-time chase winner, 0-29 over hurdles, held by a few of these on latest run
runners.spotlight: Two-time chase winner is 0-29 over hurdles; went close at Naas (2m, good to yielding) in December off 80 and is just 2lb higher now; has a bit to find with a few of these on his Cork run on latest; others hold more pressing claims.

runners.name: Kir Royal Blou
runners.breeder: S C E A Elevage De La Croix De Place
runners.comment: Huge odds and well beaten all five starts, tongue-tie now tried, hard to make a case for
runners.spotlight: Huge odds and no impact in five runs over hurdles, including in handicaps the last twice; tongue-tie now added to cheekpieces; hard to make a case for.

runners.name: Notevenatext
runners.comment: 0-5 over hurdles, encouraging h'cap debut, place claims off same mark if building on it
runners.spotlight: 0-5 over hurdles; showed nothing in first four starts but signs of life when a 13l sixth of 16 on handicap debut at Thurles last month; that was an encouraging effort and he could sneak a place here off the same mark if building on it.

3:27.going_detailed: GOOD (Good to yielding in places; watered)

runners.name: Nowwhatdoyouthink
runners.comment: Well-backed when landing Thurles maiden hurdle last month; respected on handicap bow
runners.spotlight: Runner-up to Romeo Coolio and a win on the point-to-point circuit; bumper winner showed nothing in first three maiden hurdles over a range of trips; well-backed when landing Thurles maiden (15.5f, good to yielding) last month; respected on handicap bow.

quotes.race: ThurlesRaces.ie Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: He has sound point-to-point form and Nowwhatdoyouthink's Cork bumper win is working out well. He got a bang in Listowel so you would forgive him that but we couldn't believe how bad he was at Punchestown and we found he had an issue with his wind so we got that tidied up and that was obviously a big help today. You see how lairy he was at the finish. Hopefully better races, where he'd be running at horses would suit. We were dreaming big at one stage but we're starting small again here and working our way back up - Ray Hackett, trainer, speaking to Racing TV.

quotes.race: Woodlands House Hotel Adare (Pro/Am) INH Flat Race
quotes.quote: Nowwhatdoyouthink is still a big baby and if he had a lead for longer it would have been better. It wouldn't make sense to jump hurdles now so he'll either go to Punchestown for a winners' bumper or go out to grass - Ray Hackett, trainer

runners.name: The Dancing Tree
runners.comment: Beaten a head on handicap debut over C&D in January; big player if he handles quick ground
runners.spotlight: Course bumper winner on heavy; three moderate maiden hurdle runs in order to qualify for a mark; beaten only a head on handicap debut over C&D off 108 on heavy in January; big player if he handles quicker ground.

stable_tour.quote: He won a bumper at Limerick last season and ran a lot better than the result when sixth at Cheltenham in another bumper last month. He was only getting going at the furlong pole and he got knocked around turning in and was very green and babyish. I wasn't as disappointed with the run as I was with the result. He'll go for a maiden hurdle now. 12-11-24

He ran a lot better than the result when sixth at Cheltenham in a bumper last month. He was only getting going at the furlong pole, having got knocked around turning in, and was very green and babyish. He'll go for a maiden hurdle now. 13-11-24

runners.name: Mercury Mission
runners.breeder: Flaxman Stables Ireland Limited & R Cantoni
runners.comment: Placed six times over hurdles before finally getting off the mark narrowly at Wexford
runners.spotlight: Placed six times over hurdles before finally getting off the mark narrowly at Wexford (2m, good to yielding) off 100 last month; 6lb higher mark to contend with doesn't allow much room to work with but not discounted.

runners.name: Its Not Over Yet
runners.comment: Both wins were over 3m on soft or yielding; trip and ground possibly against her on return
runners.spotlight: Was bidding for hat-trick at Roscommon when last seen 177 days ago, but she never recovered from a bad mistake three out and was tailed off; both wins were over 3m on soft or yielding; trip and ground possibly against her.

runners.name: Kingdom Calling
runners.comment: Shock 250-1 maiden hurdle winner at Listowel but fair way below that level since
runners.spotlight: Shock 250-1 maiden hurdle winner at Listowel (2m, soft) last September; fair way below that level since and tailed off in handicaps on last three runs; others more convincing.

quotes.race: John Lynch Memorial Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: I'm delighted as Kingdom Calling had been making a fool out of me last year and is a lovely horse going forward and I think he will improve. We thought he was a bumper horse last year but he was running too keen and was petering out at the back-end of his races. The last day in Tramore, Philip Enright got him to relax, to breathe and do everything right but he thought mentally he was still childish - Eoin McCarthy, trainer.

runners.name: Redcliff Glen
runners.comment: First win over hurdles here off 94 in October; poor since; market may reveal expectations
runners.spotlight: Gained his first win over hurdles at this venue (16.5f, good) off 94 in October at odds of 40-1; uncompetitive from this mark in two subsequent runs, including when falling early at Punchestown in November; the market may reveal expectations.

runners.name: Andyourbirdcansing
runners.comment: Maiden hurdle winner at Sligo last summer; now back hurdling after poor efforts chasing
runners.spotlight: Maiden hurdle winner at Sligo (2m2f, good) last summer; 0-7 since sent chasing in September; pick of her hurdles form offers hope off current mark but she's a risky proposition.

4:02.race_name: D & J Glazing (C & G) Maiden Hurdle
4:02.going_detailed: GOOD (Good to yielding in places; watered)

runners.name: Ask Phil
runners.comment: Ask gelding, dam a sister to a 2m3f-2m5f winner, probably best watched on debut
runners.spotlight: Ask gelding is a first foal; dam pulled up in bumper and point, sister to 2m3f-2m5f hurdle/chase winner Tales Of The Tweed, out of unraced half-sister to 7f Flat/2m hurdle winner Bula Rose; this looks a suitable trip for debut and yard had a winner at Dundalk recently but probably best watched.

runners.name: Carrigg Island
runners.comment: Papal Bull gelding, dam half-sister to a point winner, watch unless the market speaks
runners.spotlight: Son of Papal Bull is a second foal; dam third in a bumper, half-sister to point winner Ardkilly Celt, out of 1m winning half-sister to 1m5f Group 2 winner Lochbuie; probably best watched on debut unless the market speaks in his favour.

runners.name: Daws Cross
runners.comment: Doyen gelding, half-brother to winners, hooded, yard has stronger claims with stablemate
runners.spotlight: One of two for yard; Doyen gelding is a sixth foal; half-brother to winners Castle Field Boy (2m4f/3m hurdle) and Out The Glen (2m4f-3m1f hurdle/chase); dam placed 2m-2m3f hurdles; hooded for debut and yard has a better chance with Mashalla Habibi.

runners.name: Diablo Loco
runners.comment: Schiaparelli gelding, brother to the smart hurdler Indefatigable, interesting newcomer
runners.spotlight: Schiaparelli gelding went unsold for £38,000 as a 3yo; sixth foal; brother to bumper, 1m4f Flat (RPR 92) and smart 2m-3m hurdle winner Indefatigable, half-brother to bumper winner Litigate; unraced dam out of US 1m1f Grade 3 winner; appeals on paper and is an interesting newcomer.

runners.name: Mashalla Habibi
runners.comment: 0-4 over hurdles and rated 116, sets the standard and dam won on good, the one to beat
runners.spotlight: 0-4 over hurdles but has shown ability and is rated 116; solid effort when 12l behind Koktail Divin at Leopardstown (2m4f, yielding) on penultimate; fell on latest at Navan; sets the standard here and should be hard to beat if handling the quicker ground (dam won on good).

runners.name: Mikey Maloo
runners.comment: 125-1 for debut at Clonmel and never got involved, hard to fancy after that effort
runners.spotlight: Sent off at 125-1 for his debut at Clonmel and never got involved; difficult to fancy on the back of that effort.

runners.name: Thetownilovedsowel
runners.comment: Point winner, related to a couple of winners, could go well if fit for racecourse bow
runners.spotlight: Shirocco gelding won his sole point-to-point start at Tattersalls by 4l on good to yielding ground last October; that form hasn't worked out but he did it nicely and he's a half-brother to a couple of rules winners; could go well if fit for his racecourse debut.

runners.name: Burlington House

prev_owners.owner: The Sarkar Family & Newsells Park Stud

runners.comment: 0-8 on Flat and rated 49, half-brother to 2m3f hurdles winner, lacks a run, check market
runners.spotlight: Flat recruit rated 49 in that sphere after eight runs for Henry Spiller and Dylan Cunha; half-brother to a 2m3f hurdles winner; lacks a recent run and probably best watched unless the market suggests otherwise.

runners.name: Jonny Carrol
runners.comment: Harzand gelding, half-brother to 3m-3m2f winner, market will reveal expectations on debut
runners.spotlight: Harzand gelding cost 7,500euros as a 3yo; sixth foal; half-brother to 3m/3m2f chase winner Instant Gambler; dam German maiden, sister to winners Ole Companero (French 1m7f-2m7f jumps inc Listed chase) and Ole Caballero; newcomer from respected source; market will reveal expectations.

runners.name: Kellys Cosmos
runners.comment: Pulled up in both point to points on heavy and good to yielding, can only be watched
runners.spotlight: Failed to complete in two point-to-points on heavy and good to yielding ground, pulling up in both; can only be watched on racecourse debut.

4:37.race_name: Ishka Irish Spring Water Handicap Hurdle
4:37.going_detailed: GOOD (Good to yielding in places; watered)

runners.name: Millstream Lady
runners.owner: Eamon Leahy & Seamus Oriordan & Edward Hayes
runners.comment: 3-15 over hurdles, all on soft; hard to fancy on this ground & looks stable second string
runners.spotlight: 3-15 over hurdles, all on soft; landed 2m4f mares' handicap at this course over Christmas; 6lb higher now and was tailed off at Naas in February; hard to fancy on this ground and looks stable second string.

quotes.race: Mr. Binman Mares Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Millstream Lady put up a great performance to win under that weight. She has been very consistent and is still improving. She can go up in grade and in trip - Eric McNamara, trainer.

quotes.race: Full Circle Series At Punchestown Festival 2024 Qualifier Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Millstream Lady is not overly big but she has plenty of guts. She stays further and did this well. We might just keep her for the final of this series now - Eric McNamara, trainer.

runners.name: West Away
runners.comment: Took his form to new heights last summer; needed the run at Naas last month; stable flying
runners.spotlight: Took his form to new heights last summer, runner-up in competitive Punchestown handicap hurdle before going one better at Roscommon (20.5f, good); beaten favourite at Cartmel next time; needed the run at Naas last month; stable in flying form.

quotes.race: Midsummer's Day With The Stars On Sunday, 23rd June Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: West Away got a very good ride from Dylan and it was good to reward him. He has developed into a good horse. He had been running in good quality races for the grade so it was great to win one. He could go to Cartmel for a big pot - John McConnell, trainer.

runners.name: Rock On Seamie
runners.comment: Regressive for a while and tried at a range of trips; fell early at Gowran in February
runners.spotlight: Both hurdle wins came over 2m, the latest at Downpatrick in the summer of 2023; regressive since and tried at a range of trips; fell early at Gowran in February; much to prove.

quotes.race: Tote Always SP Or Better At Downpatrick Opportunity Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Rock On Seamie was good today, I was afraid of the hill here. He travels really well in his races but sometimes doesn't see it out, but Daniel gave him a real positive ride and it worked out - Ray Hackett, trainer.

quotes.race: Thank You To All Frontline Workers Handicap (Div I)
quotes.quote: Rock On Seamie wasn't seeing out 1m4f last year but I might step him up again as he seems a bit stronger this year. We might look at running him in the Apprentice Derby - Ray Hackett, trainer

quotes.race: Visit Tipperary Handicap (Div II)
quotes.quote: The hurdling stood to him as he fought it out well today. It wasn't the strongest race in the world but it is great to get a win at any level. I'll see how he comes out of it but he is in a 1m3f handicap at Limerick on Saturday and if he is okay we'll go again. He takes his racing very well and was just unlucky with problems last year when he missed most of the year - Ray Hackett, trainer

runners.name: Silver King
runners.comment: Sole hurdles win came at Punchestown in January 2024 off 109; back hurdling now; risky
runners.spotlight: Sole hurdles win came at Punchestown (20.5f, soft) in January 2024 off 109; has largely struggled since; 0-9 over fences; reverts back to hurdling; capable but risky.

quotes.race: Book Your Festival Hospitality Novice Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Silver King was good today and he will stay over hurdles now. He had a bad experience here over fences last time and I decided that was enough. We are very happy with that and hopefully the horses are coming back to themselves - Oliver McKiernan, trainer

runners.name: Quest With Speed
runners.comment: Maiden win around here; well beaten when midfield in Cork handicap latest; not discounted
runners.spotlight: Sole win came in a course maiden (2m3f, heavy) last season; best run when runner-up in valuable 2m4f handicap at Punchestown festival; well beaten when midfield in Cork handicap after break three weeks ago; not discounted if he can build on that.

runners.name: Grange Walk
runners.comment: Third in valuable 2m1f handicap chase off 126 at the DRF; has an exploitable hurdles mark
runners.spotlight: Just the one win since 2021; alternating between hurdles and fences of late; ran his best race for some time when third in valuable 2m1f handicap chase off 126 at the DRF; better over shorter than this but has an exploitable hurdles mark.

quotes.race: "Bet Through The Free Racing Post App" Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Grange Walk is a fair horse who is only coming to himself. He'll probably go on for the Dan Moore at Fairyhouse from here. I was very happy coming here - I couldn't believe that Danny Mullins went to Kempton [to ride Tornado Flyer in the King George]. This horse is only a six-year-old so time is on his side - John Ryan, trainer.

quotes.race: Frank O'Beirne Memorial Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Grange Walk is a proper one and I think he would have won at Galway but for falling. Bryan (Cooper) said he won with something in hand. He's only six and the sky is the limit for him. He'll be a novice chaser, not a handicapper - John Ryan, trainer.

quotes.race: Adare Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: Grange Walk is going to be a smashing chaser. He's very scopey and Danny (Mullins) has loved him from the first time he schooled him.  He actually turned to me then and said we have a Draycott Place or Kylecrue back again in terms of the way this lad jumps. He'll probably go for the two miles and two furlongs in Galway next. Two miles is his trip but he gets that distance no problem on good ground - John Ryan, trainer.

quotes.race: Doneraile Walk Maiden Hurdle (Div II)
quotes.quote: Danny gave Grange Walk a peach of a ride today, I thought he was absolutely brilliant. We were short a little bit of fitness so we held him up a bit. He'll go to Listowel now for a novice or a handicap. He probably wasn't ready for the novice in Galway and the hill probably caught him a bit. He is a good horse and can go wherever he likes - John Ryam, trainer

runners.name: My Friend The Wind
runners.owner: Exors Of The Late Sean Curran
runners.comment: Runner-up twice over hurdles at Ballinrobe last summer; good third here in December
runners.spotlight: Better hurdler (2-24, placed ten times) than chaser (0-11, placed twice); strong in the betting when runner-up twice over hurdles at Ballinrobe last summer; good third here in December; ground versatile; leading contender for local yard.

quotes.race: TipperaryRacecourse.ie Handicap Hurdle (Div II)
quotes.quote: My Friend The Wind was a very backward horse last year. We left him off for three or four months and he seems to have turned the corner a good bit since he came in. He'll improve for better ground. His jumping has always been a problem for him even though he has an awful lot of schooling done. He jumped well today, bar the second last - that was a big help for him. He's a two-and-a-half-mile horse on better ground, I think. I'd say it was a poor race but he did it well and Conor gave him a grand ride, everything worked out well - Eric McNamara, trainer.

runners.name: Ballinoe Blaze
runners.comment: Struggled off marks in the 100s; more needed but falling mark and better ground will help
runners.spotlight: Third in an ordinary maiden at Clonmel (16.5f, yielding) in December; struggled off marks in the 100s in testing conditions since sent handicapping; much more needed but falling mark and better ground should help.

runners.name: Slip Jig
runners.comment: Fine seventh of 20 at Cork over 2m4f off 99 three weeks ago; enters the discussion
runners.spotlight: Won mares' maiden hurdle at Tipperary (2m1f, yielding) last May; handicap runs over various trips not entirely convincing but fine seventh of 20 at Cork over 2m4f off 99 three weeks ago; enters the discussion.

runners.name: One And Only

runners.spotlight: Dual point-to-point winner but has struggled in five hurdle outings, never a factor in 2m7f handicap at Punchestown on latest; others preferred.

runners.name: Flemens Intrest

quotes.race: Munster Suite @ Limerick Handicap Hurdle (Div I)
quotes.quote: He hasn't been easy to be fair. Small problems but always a problem. You couldn't fancy Flemens Intrest because every day we ran him there was something wrong. He got ulcers at the start of the year and then we said we'd wait for the better ground. We'll see what the handicapper does, we'll have a bit of fun with him - David Barry, trainer, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.name: Stellium
runners.comment: Pulled up on first run over timber in close to two years at Leopardstown on stable debut

runners.spotlight: Won Kilbeggan handicap hurdle (2m3f, good to yielding) last summer off 90 under 5lb claimer; ran well for a long way on second chase start when sixth at Clonmel two weeks ago; first-time cheekpieces.

runners.name: Royal Time
runners.comment: Disappointing favourite at Leopardstown on latest but could bounce back up in trip
runners.spotlight: Off the mark at fourth attempt in handicaps at Naas (2m, good to yielding) in December off 88; up 7lb and ran another solid race at Punchestown on soft next time; disappointing favourite at Leopardstown on latest but could bounce back up in trip.

runners.name: The Mass Path

runners.spotlight: Placed in three of his 14 starts over hurdles and a third in 2m4f Clonmel beginners' chase last summer; midfield in Cork handicap hurdle in December; beaten just over 1l into third over C&D last May off 97; JJ Slevin an eyecatching booking; monitor the market.

runners.name: Great Bird

runners.spotlight: Showed very little in three maiden hurdles over 2m-2m3f to date; has always looked like a handicap project so the market will be revealing; not discounted.

runners.name: Beeverstown Place
runners.comment: 0-13 over hurdles but has run well in defeat, including when 2nd at Clonmel two weeks ago
runners.spotlight: 0-13 over hurdles but has run well in defeat, including when runner-up at Clonmel (18.5f, good) two weeks ago when sent off favourite, plugging on gamely to the line; 2lb higher but commands plenty of respect.

runners.comment: Much-improved on handicap debut when 4th at Gowran; top claimer takes over off same mark
runners.spotlight: Maiden form didn't amount to much but much-improved on his handicap debut when fourth of 20 at Gowran (2m, soft) last month, staying on well from rear; top claimer takes over from same mark; player up in trip if he handles the ground.

runners.name: He Might Be Lucky
runners.comment: Form of distant 4th at Clonmel has worked out but tailed off at Fairyhouse since
runners.spotlight: Pulled up in two starts under rules in 2023; remote fourth of 17 behind Willie Mullins-trained hotpot at Clonmel on return in January (form has worked out well); tailed off in Fairyhouse maiden when last seen; the jury is out on handicap debut.

runners.name: Dolly Watkins

runners.name: Dunany Point

runners.spotlight: Soundly beaten in three maiden hurdle outings and no better on his handicap debut when pulled up at Tramore; readily passed over here.

runners.name: Connemara Shore

runners.spotlight: Not much sign of ability in four maiden hurdles at 2m-2m4f but made slight improvement on her handicap debut when beaten 23l into seventh at Clonmel two weeks ago; keep an eye on the market.

runners.name: Ellies Rock

runners.spotlight: Half-sister to the talented Thunder Rock but she has shown very little in five outings to date; hopes hinge on tackling handicaps from a workable mark.

runners.comment: Wasn't beaten that far when 7th of 18 at Naas last week, hampered in the process; reserve

runners.spotlight: Well beaten when sent off at odds of 33-1 on her debut at Wexford last month; best watched again.

runners.spotlight: Form of her debut third at Ballinrobe was well-advertised by runner-up Windbeneathmywings; remote third here in November; step up in trip should suit; stable debut.
